Reviews.Title: “Fantastic decor”
Reviews.Author: AnnabellaRose
Reviews.Content: Lives up to its name. Staff were helpful. Room was clean. decent location within walking distance of city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenUnicorn
Reviews.Content: What did we like about the Vibe? Its number one asset, we felt was the front desk staff. No matter what question we asked, we got excellent answers that were actually accurate. (This is in direct contrast to the front desk staff at a Savannah, GA boutique hotel where we stayed last fall!) If we needed dinner recommendations, we got them. One staff member recommended taking the train to one stop past the Sydney Harbor Bridge and then walking back across the bridge. A staff member also helped us figure out how to take a train to get to the Girl Guides shop which had moved from three blocks away to an industrial park on the way to the airport. Another staff member told us they did not call cabs, but she assured us we would have no trouble getting a cab at 4 am to get to the airport. True! We had a cab in 10 seconds....... We are walkers, and we really liked the location of the Vibe. Close enough to walk back from The Rocks, close to Darling Harbour and Chinatown.......Also close to the Town Square Mall which had a Coles Supermarket, a liquor store, various shops--pretty much whatever we were going to need. Also, the hotel was only about two blocks from the train station, so we were able to take the train from the airport and pull our bags those two blocks instead of paying for a cab from the airport. This hotel is not as hip as we thought based on the pictures......and each night a different senior citizens bus tour seemed to be pulling up to the hotel! Gotta fill those rooms! Our room was a very good size for a city hotel, good sized and comfortable king size bed, large bathroom. The TV was a plasma that was very small for the size of the room and which had virtually no channels. We elected to read and compute instead. Walls seemed a bit thin, since I could hear a person coughing next door now and then. Internet is a rip-off $25 Aus per day, but there was a 3 day package that made it like $20 a day. We were on the 9th floor. Good news: that's the floor where the exercise room and the rooftop pool are located. Bad news: the elevator stops at the 8th floor. Start climbing! The front desk offered to bring our bags up, but my husband likes to do it himself, so he got some more exercise. Would I book again at the Vibe if I found myself in Sydney again? Probably. The room price was such a value when contrasted with the ridiculous rates being charged at the Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: KathLChoo
Reviews.Content: Well, this is my first time staying at Vibe Hotel, as I've seen pretty good reviews on it, and especially with the general manager commenting on each and every review on Trip Advisor, i decided to give it a shot! What disappoint me most was on my second day of stay, i experienced the fire alarm twice, once in the afternoon and the second time at 2am midnight! That was half an hour each wasted for that day. Besides, having the housekeeper knock and saying it's housekeeping before entering room for clean up should be normal procedures, but housekeeper opened the door in less than 1sec after knocking and DIDN'T mentioning that they are housekeepers. If only my door were not locked, she could have seen us naked! Third experience would be THROWING MY IMPORTANT DOCUMENTS away when I've placed them nicely on the table to indicate that those are important! I have my assignments, flight boarding pass and airport pick up documents thrown away! How ridiculous is that! Although the receptionist had been very nice by offering to print my documents all over again, the time required to look for all my documents and to save on my hard disk and to wait for them to print is so time-consuming! It wasted me another hour for doing all these when I didn't have to! The hotel offered us of either free breakfast or $50 refund for the night of fire alarm. Though we took the $50 refund, but seriously, is my time wasted for all these nonsense worth only $50? This hotel is close to the city, near the train station, has clean rooms and the design for my room looked pretty decent. HOWEVER, I DON'T THINK I AM EVER GOING TO STAY AT VIBE!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: Due to an unexpected medical condition, we needed to extend our four-day visit to Sydney, and thanks to the friendly Vibe staff, an otherwise problematic situation turned out quite well. At first we needed to stay only one extra night, but just as Easter began, we needed our room yet another night. Although the hotel had lots of new guests arriving, we got a good deal and could keep our executive suite without problems. The Danish manager even called us in our room to check on our situation. Luckily it wasn't anything ruining the rest of our trip (onwards to Christchurch) and we are happy to recommend this Vibe to other travellers. The roof-top pool and fitness room are both quite small, but overall the standard and ambience is top. Clean and spacy room and bath, well-functioning a/c and as mentioned: friendly staff. Can also highly recommend the Macchiato restaurant/grill on the corner of Liverpool and Pitt, just a block away. Cute waitresses and excellent food! Another great option for dinner close to Vibe is right down Goulburn to the Civil Grill, where they serve excellent $12 signature dishes in various flavors: Steaks, burgers, seafood etc. Although you might have to wait a while for the kitchen to process your order, it is definitely worth the wait. Vibe is located smartly in walking distance to the best of Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Poor- would not return”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: We stated in the Vibe on a trip from UK, this was the poorest hotel of all the places we stayed, it gives the impression of a once grand hotel that has been "tarted up" in an attempt to look young and trendy, it does not work! My biggest gripe is the lack of attention to detail and the total lack of service, this hotel is clearly trying to operate on a shoestring. You can do better in Sydney for about the same money, don't be tempted by the discounts

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Central”
Reviews.Author: GJ E
Reviews.Content: Very pleased to discover this hotel after some real hit and miss Sydney hotel experiences in the past. We tend to stay most nights in a hotel of this price range then the final night in a luxury hotel, but would have been more than happy to stay here for the full trip. The rooms are modern and clean (and not fluro like the other areas!) and we were pleased to qualify for a free night due to our multi night booking. The staff were very friendly - check in was welcoming and the cleaning staff gave us extra toiletries which was a nice touch. An easy walk to main amenities, including the Central Station. The bathroom was very good and they had lovely toiletries which makes it a bit more special. Breakfast was as good as any I have had anywhere else but we didn't have it more than once as other places are so close. The only blips for us was that there seemed to be a lot of non hotel guests hanging around the lobby lounge which was odd and at times a little unnerving and when we booked the hold that was on the credit card took two weeks to come off even though we paid for the room when we left. This was frustrating as, being visitors from New Zealand, we could have used more funds to spend on activities/shopping in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad - won't be staying again”
Reviews.Author: happiestcamper000
Reviews.Content: Used to stay in this hotel back in 2005 - was a great hotel back then. I don't think a single thing has been done to the hotel since then - the corridors stank of wet carpet, the room was tired with frayed carpet, old doona cover, the plumbing for the toilet made loud clanking and banging noises when the toilet was flushed, and they demanded a $200 credit card bond on check in (i've never heard of this amount being required before). The staff were friendly and professional, but overall the hotel was crap and I won't be staying again - definitely not worth $200 per night!!

Reviews.Title: “Sydneys secret hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozteam888
Reviews.Content: We just discovered the Vibe Hotel at 111 Goulbourne St, Its so close to Chinatown and World Square. A short walk from Centeral Station it is perfectly located for that city getaway! The rooms are a good size, big comfortable king bed with a mini fridge and coffee making gear, LCD TV, Foxtel, Broadband etc. The price was quite reasonable at $139 for a 4 Star hotel in a centeral location. On the roof there is a small, well equipped Gym and a great swimming pool that gets sun all day! The only downside was the breakfast was a bit bland but fresh and OK for a night or two. The desk staff were helpful and housekeeping staff were great. All in all a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: daveinpixels
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend - and unfortunately I wont be asking their advice again. The hotel wasn't bad, the simple things just weren't done. A large group checked in before me and the staff were obviously a bit frustrated - so I bared the brunt of that with short, sharp, grumpy answers. Thats understandable, we all have terrible days, but when I got to my room I was a bit disappointed with its cleanliness - especially the bathroom. The bath surrounds were dirty which turned me off wanting to use it as a bath. As others have said, the TV doesn't actually turn on with the remote - it just changes channels and turns it off. I needed to manually turn it on when i used it. Dont expect a large foxtel selection either as it is just a few select channels. Maybe it was just my room, but it seemed when some rooms ran their water - it made a large whistling noise. Very annoying at 2am!! The hotel is in a pretty good spot and there are a few convenience stores around if you want to get something a bit different from the hotel food selections - as well as some authentic indian restaurants within easy walking distance. I paid just under $200 for a night at this hotel which is OK, but $300+ for the following. At this price, there are much better places in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a decent price in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: travelingenigma
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations, we spent 4 nights here while visiting Sydney. They location was awesome! So close to the subway and just easy. It was so nice to have a place to go after 24 hours of travel. We were able to drop off bags and then catch a quick bite to eat and one of the cafe's close by. The location is easy to walk to and from and easy to hop and off subway also. They have a nice roof top terrace with pool. Our room was on the same floor. The house keeping did a great job and staff was also very nice and friendly. Lots of places close by to eat. Fridge in room is nice for when you want to stock up on a few things from 7/11 etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky with big rooms”
Reviews.Author: kurrypowder
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very funky. Staff were very friendly and helpful, all the sites and highlights of sydney were within walking distance. It suited two highly jet laged people to be able to watch knight rider at 4am! very comfy beds and big rooms. There was a handly mini bus from and to the airport. However we only knew about this once at the hotel. Bathroom was massive very clean really nice shower. The pool on the roof was very cold but the place was nicly done with nice change rooms and a gym. Only negative it the breakfast which we opted out of were $30 per person a little steep for a mid range hotel. We would stay there again nice place for a short stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stop "Down Under"”
Reviews.Author: sidecarrider
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Vibe Hotel almost a year before our arrival and got an excellent rate thru Agoda Hotels. We planned to stay there one night before departing the next day on a two week Holland America Cruise of Australia and New Zealand. After traveling over 25 hours with little sleep on the airliners we arrived in Sydney at 8:30AM and took a prearranged shuttle to the Vibe. I was fearful that such an early arrival would mean waiting for a room, but to our delight our room was waiting for us and after a very warm welcome we were happy to see a clean comfortable room. I think any beds at that time would have been comfortable but indeed the beds at the Vibe were comfortable as we took a few hours nap (we aimed to try to get used to the new time zone before starting the cruise the next day. After lunch we then noticed that one of our pieces of luggage was missing. The shuttle company had failed to load it at Sidney Airport. We only had our home address on the tags (Not the Vibe or Cruise information). We immediately informed the Vibe staff or our dilemma and were told there were several shuttle companies and I did not have a receipt of the one I used! The Vibe staff made several calls and by the next morning our luggage was reunited with us! This "extra mile" service was very appreciated as this luggage was our formal clothes for the cruise and would have limited our enjoyment (and budget!). If ever in Sydney again I will stay at the Vibe, it is close to shopping, restaurants and sightseeing opportunities. What a nice first experience of the friendliness of the Australian people and especially those at the Vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty”
Reviews.Author: RollingLucky
Reviews.Content: Was on the first floor and found the hotel to be filthy dirty throughout. As we on first floor there was a business conference held there earlier in the day and leftover food, coffee, teas and trash just left sitting there for at least 1 day. Room 102 was dirty as same with the entire first floor. Even elevators and hallways very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: sansbell
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Sydney for less than 24 hours and The Vibe in Sydney was perfect! Great lobby, large room with a sofa and desk, and separate area for the fridge and wardrobe....great lighting, large mirrors. I had dinner at the fabulous restaurant downstairs and to get a lock for my suitcase and there was a convenience store right down the street! 4 stars and value for $$$$$

Reviews.Title: “Good, but far from great”
Reviews.Author: Marie L
Reviews.Content: Was expecting a little better than what we received at Vibe (for the money spent)... reasonably clean, small room, with ordinary outlook. Convenient enough for access to transport, but plenty of more attractive locations to stay in what is a brilliant city.

Reviews.Title: “Massive inconvenience!!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahandChrisAsh
Reviews.Content: The stay itself was great. As we arrived at the hotel a $200 bond was held on my Debit Card. Upon check out the reception staff charged the full amount to my bank card. A week after my stay I checked my bank account and the $200 bond was still pending on my Debit Card and had overdrawn the account. I called the reception and they told me it had nothing to do with them and that I had to contact my bank to get my money back. The website also said there was a pool and sauna. We got ready and went up for a swim, only to find an Out of order sign on both. Which the reception staff had failed to tell us. $250 a night for just a room and no breakfast included and all facilities Out of Order was definitley NOT worth it! Absolute joke! VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!

Reviews.Title: “Great value but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: DrKoob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe following a 10-day cruise. We had looked at lots of hotels in advance and would like to have stayed closer to the waterfront but I have this thing about hotels. I hate to pay more than $200 a night to stay in a hotel that isn't offering me something incredible. Don't get me wrong. We have stayed in some world-class, amazing hotels but I was lucky enough to get them all at a huge bargain. Like grabbing a wonderful room at Edinburgh's Balmoral the night after the World Cup Soccer matches for less than $150. Or finding an internet special for the Hong Kong Langham. But I could not find a single hotel near the waterfront (that we could stay in) that was under $275 a night. So I went to Trip Adviser and found a high rated hotel, near the city center and within walking distance of Sydney's superb transit system and the Vibe fit that bill perfectly. We paid less than $150 a night, it was a very nice room (see the pic) in a boutique type hotel (we love those rather than chains) and we could walk to the subway which took us everywhere in under 10 minutes.The rooms were clean, had all the needed amenities and I would not hesitate to go back and stay at the Vibe again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_paul
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room on floor 7 opposite the lift. Had a view of centre point tower. Rooms are very large with a big wardrobe. Found the bed a little hard when I sat on it at first but didn't bother me during the night. One problem was the lack of amenities in the bathroom. The soap hadnt been restocked but I had the shampoo etc when I called down stairs to ask the lady explained they didn't offer soap?! When returning from dinner I asked a guy at the front desk who went & got me some straight away. Didnt use or see the pool/gym. The room had been paid up front but we still had to give a credit card or 200$ deposit for security.

Reviews.Title: “very, very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_Traveler_83
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed in the Vibe Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of February 2012. As we were travelling through Australia we have seen a few hotels in NSW an other parts in Australia and I unfortunately have to say the Vibe Hotel definately was the worst experience on our journey. When we arrived we got welcomed quite unfriendly (thats not something you want to experience after a 22 hours flight). We then got told that we got upgraded to family room, which meant that me and my gf got a very inconvenient and small room crowded with 3 kingsize beds. The room was in a quite bad condition; windows were old and damaged (couldnt even close them properly why it was noisy from the traffic outside) and there were further defects on furnitures and on the carpet. The cleaness was the most disappointing as the room from a objective perspective was very dirty. Not only that the bed sheets were full of splotches and that the floor in both bedroom and bathroom was very dirty, but also were the walls soiled and almost all pieces of furniture not clean. Despite the good location of the hotel, the view from our room (think was 3rd or 4th floor) was to the back, looking directly at an old building not beeing able to see anything. There is a gym on the top floor which is well-equiped and clean as well a a small sauna and some showers, both in pristine condition. The service we got from the reception when asking for the tourist-bus etc. was not satisfying and again not very friendly. Our clothes we gave to the hotels laundry we have been told to come to the front desk to pick it up when calling them to ask for it. We were shocked when we got told that internet costs 25 AUD per 24h and think was AUD 15 for 1h !!! Our conclusion: for the price we payed in the Vibe we could definately have expected something better and could have gone to another place in Sydney. So we cannot recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Fred E
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Booking.com and got a very reaonable deal because we booked well ahead. The prices would have been quite a bit higher had we waited. The reviews on Tripadvisor helped a lot. We stayed 4 days and were very pleased with the accomodaions and the location. The rooms weren't huge but clean and served us well. Staff was always helpful and pleasant. Circular Quay was within walking distance (long walk) but it was only a block from the location where you could catch the free 555 bus (9AM to 3PM weekdays and 9AM to 6PM weekends) to get to the Quay and The Rocks area. It was about a $15 cab ride to/from the Quay. The hotel was also only a couple of blocks away from the monorail that will get you to Darling Harbor and only a block from the Museum train station. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dodgy room”
Reviews.Author: Louie67
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Vibe, it was ok, wouldn't rush back but that may be because of the room we were given. We requested a high floor but got room 313 (we did book through wotif), requested a king bed but got a double and two singles. I guess every request can't be accommodated but it is disappointing. The windows in the room were filthy and there was lots of water damage on the walls near the windows. Tiles in the bathroom need regrouting. Bed not very comfortable. Breakfast was included in our rate..it was adequate but not too exciting. Location is very handy to the city and Chinatown, very close to the 555 free bus loop.

Reviews.Title: “Real service, real style, REALLY GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: fluffy63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a pre cruise night at the Vibe and were astounded at the quality of service and the quality of the accommodation. The reception staff were wonderfully accommodating and we were offered an upgrade on the night of our arrival to a one bedroom suite, located on the 5th floor. Although a little traffic noise was audible in the morning, we slept well during the course of the night. The only negative I could list is the bed ... this was exceptionally soft, old and had several protruding/noisy springs which was evidence of its wear and tear factor and really needed replacing. The breakfast staff were courteous and very helpful and would like to thank them for making our breakfast experience a memorable one. The location of the Vibe is central and convenient and I would defintely stay here again when next in Sydney. By the way, if you enjoy a good massage, there is an excellent Thai massage place virtually a one minute walk away on the same side of the road. It is near the convenience shop on the corner. Wonderful massage at a reasonable price - 60 minutes cost us $90.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: kazbahh
Reviews.Content: Returned here after enjoyable time on previous stay. Booked quad room again. Rooms always well clean and equipped. Handy location and reasonably priced. Would recommend a stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very good, especially for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FMoha
Reviews.Content: Now as a Melbournian, people may think am a tad biased! I've stayed in a number of Sydney hotels, and I must say for a mid-range, quality stay, I couldn't go past the Vibe. Vibe was located within walking distance of most Sydney landmarks. Check in was speedy, and the reception staff were knowledgeable. Really spacious room, clean, decked out in the little things that a girl (or boy) could need. I didn't like their bar/breakfast area, and customer service there was pretty poor; though room service was good. I will stay here again (subject to cool discounts of course).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel close to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: DiederickPhoto
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the center of town this hotel is a very good option. All facilities available including a swimming pool. Efficient staff. Everything is on walking distance. Rooms are clean and big. If you book in advance (f.e. by Agoda) you can get a great discount as well as an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression Left Bad Taste in Mouth.”
Reviews.Author: nellykinz
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was adequate for our needs, as the location was good, the room was basic but nice, the facilities were adequate (besides the pool which was very cloudy/murky), But the check-in process unfortunately left a bad first impression. Firstly at check-in a $200 pre-authorisation is required to be held on your credit card by Vibe hotel. Sure, no problem, had we been notified upfront!! Having travelled extensively domestically and internationally my husband & I have learnt that the total amount of your stay is typically held (as a pre-authorisation) pending your final bill. Understandable!! If you havenâ€™t paid upfront!! When we have paid upfront, the hotels have always taken credit card details and ID as a cautionary stock measure, with no pre-authorisations being made! We have stayed from 2 star places to 5 Star places, my husband has even stayed at a 6 star (Atlantis, Dubai) and they didnâ€™t even do what Vibe Hotel wanted to do!! The Vibe Hotel Sydney works differentlyâ€¦ We paid for our 5 day stay upfront, $605 (through hotels.com). Upon arrival the hotel explained the pre-authorisation is held in case you trash the room or drink the whole mini bar, etc. Again, understandable, only, if we hadnâ€™t paid upfront!! We also provided, in accordance with their policies, credit card details and ID. The staff were extremely repetitive, insistent and unsympathetic as the $200 they required was $200 less our holiday money. If the terms & conditions, through hotels.com had stated this prior to booking or prior to our stay we would of budgeted and accounted for this. However no such documents were provided, not even by the hotel, and even upon check-in, none of the documents we were required to sign stated that this was policy and was required for check-in!!! Merely a small A4 sign at the desk and by word of the staff. After reiterating several times I understood their policy, I asked to see the Duty Manager, hoping to come to some kind of compromise. I explained that as they had failed to include this on their terms & conditions, that as they failed to notify us prior to our stay and as we had paid upfront this was an unfair application of this policy. It took me 20minutes to speak to the duty manager personally, as the front desk clerk was redundant in the explanation of said policy. The duty manager offered to half the pre-authorisation but as I know my rights as by the fair trading laws, I was not happy with the result. Finally a compromise of the $100 pre-auth. was made, with the promise that the Duty Manager would talk to the General Manager to have the funds released the following day. Thankfully this was the outcome but unfortunately it took quite a bit of negotiation, and anguish. I would not recommend this hotel, but the place itself is nice so if you can overlook service or arenâ€™t fussy, this is a cheap way to stay in Sydney. Good Holidaying Travellers â˜º

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Roddy906
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a great location in Sydney.It is within a 5 minute wak to Cafes,Bars,Shops and a Railway station

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: iajsdg
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel,very spacious room and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine property”
Reviews.Author: IndustryBuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in January (Three nights). Unfortunately January is an expensive time to travel in Sydney, so it wasn't a cheap stay. However, there were no major concerns. Upon arriving requested a quiet room away from lifts and the staff were happy to comply. The room was clean, tidy and quite fashionably designed. Nitpicking, I'd have to say the amenities in the bathroom could have been better (the soap wasn't very nice, some body wash would have gone down well), there was no real view to speak of and the air conditioning was very noisy if it was turned on. Still, for an inner-city Hotel it was lovely and quiet. Well placed for shopping and getting around, the staff were very friendly and the cocktail we had in the bar on Saturday night was lovely. While I wouldn't stay here again, it was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here.”
Reviews.Author: pugsly14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night and was pleasantly surprised by the experience. Staff very friendly and knowledgable. Room was very quiet, spacious, comfortable bed with a very modern decor. It was within short walking distance to central Sydney and all the city has to offer. Happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surprise!”
Reviews.Author: marioSyd
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel through an on line promotion which included late check out and full buffet breakfast for two. I was extremely impressed by the size of the room,with two large separate areas and a huge bed!the breakfast was deliciuos and the service excellent. Being centrally located,Chinatown, Surry Hills and other food hubs are within walking distance which makes this hotel an ideal start point. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “staff awful”
Reviews.Author: tesco
Reviews.Content: this has to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in, staff had no idea what they were doing, bar was so expensive. the hotel reckons that you can watch 2 films at once and charge you for that privilidge, I have stayed in many hotels and would never stay any where like this ever again, they say you get what you pay for, we did and did not get what we paid for. travel lodge at Hilton prices. STAFF WERE THE WORST.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb_london_27
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel. I stayed here for 6 nights. Great location, Museum station is 2 minutes walk away. I walked from the hotel, through the shopping areas and down to the harbor in 15-20 minutes. The room was very spacious and clean. The reception staff were inconsistent though. On the Sunday Morning i arrived after a 24 hour flight from London, I tried to check in early at 8am. I was immediately told that the check in time was not until 2pm, but i might be able to check in at 12 noon. The reception said as the hotel was completely full from the previous night, no rooms were available.I was exhausted at this stage. So i went to the bathroom, changed my clothes, washed up a bit and decided to head out, get some breakfast and do some exploring. I then left my bags at reception and went outside. 2 minutes later i went back in as i forgot sunblock so i asked to get my bags. A different receptionist was at the desk now and she checked my name and told me my room was fully ready. I asked if it was free earlier on or was it just cleaned and she said it was vacant the night before. So the first reception lied for some unknown reason or just didnt check properly. Apart from that incident which annoyed a jet lagged person, everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly efficient service at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: aecasey
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend up in Sydney staying at The Vibe. After some of the other reviews I had read I was a little worried that the hotel would be disappointing and not what we were hoping for but... from the moment we walked in we were greated with friendly, helpful staff and then were pleasantly surprised by our clean, large room. The decore is modern, the large flatscreen tv had austar etc and the bed was very comfortable The room was serviced daily and the ground floor cafe seemed nice but we only had a wine there on the last night. We paid a very reasonable price for our booking, which was a package deal and couldn't believe our luck at paying half the price asked by The Sheraton. Having stayed at 5 star hotels The Vibe offered everything the same without the glitz (chandeliers, marble, door person etc). The location is brilliant and within walking distance to the city (2 blocks), Chinatown (2 blocks), Circular Quay (about 20 minutes with lots to see!) and Oxford St and Paddington market is also within walking distance (15 mins). I would definately stay there again and was pleased to have the extra money to spend at one of the fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Right price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: terinay
Reviews.Content: f you're looking for a cost-friendly hotel without necessarily all the fan fare of the Ritz, then Vibe Hotel is a good choice. The decor is modern and contemporary, the check-in staff were friendly, and our room and bathroom were clean. The location is also very good. It's at the edge of the CBD so you are within walking distance of many things and at the same time, away from the hustle and bustle. The CBD free shuttle is also just around the corner. The regular paid bus stop is literally right outside the hotel entrance. Vibe Hotel's location is also within walking distance to Surry Hills, a hip neighborhood where are all the top restaurants are in the city. There is a gym and pool at the top. The gym is small but adequate. Towels are provided although it would be nice if a water fountain was also available. The pool was dry when we were there. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve 4 stars, especially service wise!”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Ottoman
Reviews.Content: Very well located, the hotel provides large rooms (40 sq meters av). Still, the carpets are quite old, the lobby quite dark! But the worse is the staff: not friendly (coming from Asia where the service is almost pzrfect, i was very desappointed) and the rooms were not cleaned everyday, just the beds done! Price wise, it was not a good value for money deal at all

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: aibileen
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Vibe, and paid $150 for the night including buffet breakfast. I felt it was worthwhile for this price; was clean and tidy, despite being a little tired in some ways. I had booked for a queen bed, and actually got a king, so that was a nice bonus! My TV didn't work initially, and promptly the reception staff came and fixed the simple problem. The hotel is at the southern end of Sydney CBD, but only a $10 cab to circular quay (to the Rocks, harbour bridge & opera house). I had a lovely view of some beautiful old buildings from the fifth floor - was a nice "city view" compared to many other hotels in cities that I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good location, no view, no service”
Reviews.Author: AndreaN2
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is quite good as not far away from any of the attractions. The rooms are of a good size for a city hotel, windows however cannot be opened and most rooms face either the next building or a back yard. Price is however also on the higher end for a four star. Service is simply bad, TV did not work on arrival, minibar was not refilled - needed to request this 3 times before being done. Cleanliness of rooms also on lower end. Would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Trevorge
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Vibe. In Sydney on business for 4 days, needed to be at the southern end of town so chose the Vibe on location and price. Although as others have noted it looks a little tired still think for what I paid it represented good value and the service was fine. Ate at the bar on ground level and food was fine if a little limited in variety. A good experience all round

Reviews.Title: “Vibe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soitgoes2007
Reviews.Content: Great location near Chinatown and Central Station. The hotel is average in appearance but the price and location compensated. Adaptors for U. S. appliances available on request.

Reviews.Title: “When I actually did stay not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: tenoctober
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews which were not glowing and commented that I would leave a review after actually staying as some comments seemed a little unfair...... They werent !!!!! Not enough staff at reception and those that were not particularly friendly. Bar/restaurant staff were nearly in a verbal altercation about who was actually going to bother to serve us one night. Our group had 10 people. Wine was very expensive, we ended up leaving shortly after being seated because we were igored by staff and aghast at prices, went to great pub across the road were service was friendly, food great and the same wine nearly a third of the price !!!!!!! Suggest the chef eats his own buffet breakfast, although the steam is coming off the cooker the food was stone called especially the eggs... oh except for the baked beans. Everything else fruit cereal etc great. Room was great cant complain about it at all, infact really good and very comfy bed. At $50.00 a night more than the Travelodge just down the road where we stayed last year I think I know where we will all be staying for our annual conference next year. Sorry Casper not a happy camper !

Reviews.Title: “5 min walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: Sedang_Farang
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the VIbe. The rooms (stayed there on 2 accasions) where spacious, clean and the airconditioning was excellent. The bed was, for me, one of the most comfortable in recent memory. Proximity to Museum train station (airport link) is aprox. 150m walk. But beware, the Sydney underground was invented long before air travel / suit cases with wheels and there are many steps to negotiate. The south Liverpool St exit has escalators and is the best way in/out. The precint seemed quite safe and I enjoyed the walk along George and Pitt St all the way down to the Quay one evening. The cafe in the hotel seemed OK - I just had coffee and a snacks there Only down side of the stay was the NETKIOSK pay as you go / coin in the slot internet in the lobby - it ate my money, when it did work it was morbidly slow (actually it was the same at the international terminal too)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location easy”
Reviews.Author: jeddi
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in a twin room and found it to be spacious, comfortable and just right for our business trip. We had breakfast there as well which was really good food, service a bit slow however. The check in and out was too slow not enough staff. Otherwise all was well.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged, rude staff and completely unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: cody w
Reviews.Content: Upon check in reception staff were so rude, unhelpful and didnt give me the time of day. I was not informed of the $200 bond until it was unknowingly charged to my account. My rate was suppose to be $165 for the one night, however I ended up paying $530 as I was charged twice for the night and then charged for the bond. I was informed after all this money had been taken from my account that $365 would be deposited back into my account after several working days. Because I was unaware of the extra charges I was left short of cash as I had only budgeted for 1 night! My account was overdrawn from the second accidental $165 dollars and the staff refused to be held responsible for any dishonour fees. They were not sorry, and did not apologise or reach an acceptable resolution. I have never felt more uncomfortable or unwelcome in my life, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Rowan62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a girl's weekend away. Our room was clean with 2 double beds. Shower was good. We arrived early and got into 1 of our rooms straight away. Stayed November 2011, travelled with friends

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some attitude”
Reviews.Author: altakoi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the vibe for a single night. The location is very good - close to the city/central area and fairly easy to the Eastern suburbs. Rooms were clean and fairly spacious for a hotel. Had the TV mounted at 90 degrees from the bed, so not good for movie watching so perhaps not a stay-in kind of place. Staff were competent. Probably a bit expensive for the overall level of service.

Reviews.Title: “nice and handy for the top of the city”
Reviews.Author: allanbowers
Reviews.Content: Vibe hotel is within walking distance of a lot of the attractions in central sydney. The hotel is fine for what it is however I have stayed in better (and cheaper) places in Sydney. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nina126
Reviews.Content: Vibe Hotel Sydney has a good location and clean, spacious & modern rooms. In my opinion it was quite expensive, but if you are willing to pay, then why not to choose it. It is a chain hotel so there is very little character in it, but on the other hand also nothing to complain about - everything worked fine and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, classy, modern. This hotel ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: faroutley
Reviews.Content: The Vibe is gorgeous! Rooftop terrace with pool is fantastic! The location can't be beat. Look no further, this is where I will stay whenever I am in Sydney. Don't hesitate to book into The Vibe!!!

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff, convenient location, great environment”
Reviews.Author: monicagragg
Reviews.Content: great location between town hall station and central station. Staff was very helpful and reliable. Got upgraded to a suite, enjoyed the piano in the suite!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Saraht83_11
Reviews.Content: We were put in a very large room on the 9th floor, the lift only goes to the 8th floor! We had to very heavy cases, not good and the receptionist wasn't interested in helping us. We had to move rooms the following day as there were terrible noises in the room, i think we were just below a generator as the light fitting in the middle of the room was vibrating violently and the area around the door was also vibrating therefore we didnt sleep very well! We were moved to a better room and a room that we could get access by the lift. The beds were hard, the furniture was worn and uncomfortable. There was mould growing in between the shower screen and the washing unit, it was disgusting, i did my best to ignore it. We were unfortunate enought to get caught in the middle of the Qantas strikes nd had to book an additional night until we could get a flight rearranged. We were originally told that the rate was $160 but once they realised Qantas were allowing $250 for accommodation they decided to charge us $250!! After trying to blatantly trying to rip us off we decided we would to elsewhere. We looked on the internet and managed to get booked into the Sheraton on the Park for $200. It was pure luxury, professional and most importantly they didnt rip us off, they actually upgraded us! To think i nearly stayed in the dive which was the Vibe!! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for Sydney visitors”
Reviews.Author: jkl615
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard queenbed room online at the last minute (~20 minutes before we arrived at the door of the hotel to check in) and on arrival we got upgraded to the kingbed room suite on the 8th floor. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and professional. The suite was indeed very spacious with large lounge area, large bedroom and large bathroom. The bathroom in particular was rather "oversized" in comparison to the shower and the bathtub it has in it. Unfortunately, there wasn't a hair-dryer to be found. Despite the suite's being on the 8th floor, the view was rather mediocre. There was also a low-piched humming mechanical noise throughout the night (and day) which I suspected to be the rooftop ventilator or A/C unit. Talking about rooftop, there was a small pool/gym/sauna and given the generous 11am check-out time, I had a chance to have a swim, which was quite nice. The location of this hotel is in one word amazing. It's within 5-10 minutes' walking distance to World Cenre and Chinatown. This is our second Vibe Hotel and on what we have experienced, we will be returning to a third Vibe Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, no hassles”
Reviews.Author: Bern71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vibe Hotel for 5 nights and read some of the reviews before my stay. I was a little worried based on some of the reviews however I was very happy with my stay. The room was clean and spacious and the bed comfortable. The location was great - close to Central Station which I found very handy. As a woman travelling on my own I am always aware of feeling safe; I felt very safe at the Vibe. The restaurant is nothing special but there are numerous great dining options in Sydney - don't limit yourself to the hotel restaurant! The hotel is also only about a 15 minute stroll to Darling Harbour and a 5 minute walk to Oxford Street. I cannot really comment on the normal room rate as I was able to get a good corporate rate. It seems accommodation in Sydney is expensive and the Vibe is probably no exception. It is annoying that you have to pay for internet though. Overall, I would recommend the Vibe and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, pricy extras”
Reviews.Author: splibo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in central location. We were very pleased to be let into our room early following a long haul flight for no extra charge. Room was clean, well serviced, and comfortable. Did not eat in the hotel as there were better alternatives nearby. We were shocked at the wifi charge so didnt take advantage! Likewise the laundry charge. Overall a nice hotel at reasonable cost, in good location. Would probably stay again if in the area, but would seek out a "deal"

Reviews.Title: “Good last minute rate - but not worth more.”
Reviews.Author: VeryFussyChick
Reviews.Content: For being a reasonably well located hotel, I got a good last minute rate with wotif - but if I had paid more I would have been unhappy. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful but the hotel is looking worn - the bright colours do little to hide the overall shabbiness. The bed wasn't that good either and the air con VERY noisy with only one fan speed, also the lifts, even though I asked for a room away from the lifts. A good sized room - but overlooking carpark and construction on neighbouring building - it was noisy in the morning. Still you don't expect a harbour view at these prices. Fodd in restaurant was good and buffet breakfast OK. I think it must have been very nice when new - refreshing change from normal hotel decor - but it needs a spruce up. Easy walk to Museum Station - the train to the airport is a rip off at $15+, I would take the shuttle bus for $14.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, but the extras will set you way back....”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel, good location, but the extras really are costly. Dry cleaning, a small bag of crisps and daily internet charges add way too much to the bill. Too bad really, as I could recommend it highly if not for these extra's....

Reviews.Title: “Poor Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Thumper5546
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, but found lack of maintenance to be an issue. My wife was unable to flush the toilet due to the button being very hard to push. We told staff twice re the peoblem but they did nothing. We also found the buffett breakfast to be of poor quality and overpriced Also when you book in they hold $200 on your credit card then it takes over a week for them to release it. Also found staff had little knowledge of the local area told us the Central Station was the closest railway station. We found out after walking for 15 min that Museam station was less than 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Maintenace required”
Reviews.Author: Wendy M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in city but not centrally located so some distance from many features of Sydney. I was in Sydney for business so all I probably needed was a comfortable bed - but found A room on the 2nd floor suffered from traffic noise making sleep difficult. Room was cleam but badly in need of maintenace e.g bedside lamp was broken and curtain hung open as missing hooks. Bathroom dark but bedroom good size. I reported things needing repair but when I returned in evening nothing had been repaired. They offered to move me to a junior suite which I accepted. However this room was needing more repairs - toilet made loud glugging sound for 15 min after flushing, shower head was broken and bathroom bin was also broken. Maintenance seemed problematic! Reception staff ranged from friendly to downright rude. At one stage I asked the young receptionist if I was invisible as she seemed to take an interest in serving young males rather than others waiting or attention. Perhaps the 'hip' colours are there to say don't come here if over 30?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights earlier this month. I had never stayed at a Vibe Hotel before. Their brand seems to be about prioviding a hip/boutique hotel feel on a budget. I liked the location and the bold use of colour throughout the hotel. I found the reception staff friendly. Unfortunately, the bar staff were less friendly (although there were only two other people in the bar, it felt like I was interrupting very harried bartenders by asking for a drink), which was a pity. The room was refreshingly not beige; I liked the colour and the functional bathroom. A couple of things have not worn well (like the very chipped joinery around the minibar), but overall I felt they had done a good job with an awkward triangular shaped room. All in all though, I thought it was good value and I appreciated the 'quirkiness on a budget' ethos. I think I will stay here again on future trips. If the bar staff were a little more friendly, it might be closer to a 5 star. and the bar did not really feel like a place I wanted

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Sparkle Clean”
Reviews.Author: RS5000
Reviews.Content: We had a long flight and we were very tired, we were thinking to wait couple of hours to check in as we were at the hotel at around 9:30am. But Receptionist was very kind to check us in early. The room was fresh and sparkle clean. There was a sofa and two single beds for us and still had enough room to move. We were there for seven nights and we had our room serviced everyday, it seemed to us to have a new room everyday, it was really outstanding service. Best value for money.The hotel is in very convenient place. Hotel Dry cleaning is very expensive, but the dry cleaners opposite the Hotel is very cheap and quick service. Overall, it was fantastic experience. Currently we are staying with our relatives and have plan to stay again for a day or two before leaving Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mike-chambers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal to explore all areas of Sydney. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, close to underground. On the free bus route and close to the train station for the Blue Mountains. Rooms are clean and big. Staff are friendly. Good Bar Can't fault the price

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: abromide
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given smelled (quite strongly) of cigarette smoke. I asked for a new room and the new one was really noisy. I never quite figured out what the noise was, but it was extremely loud/mechanical sounding and was coming through the walls on one side. I think maybe it was the building's ventilation system? To be honest, I didn't bother asking for a third room (but I also don't think I should have to!). One the positive side, the room seemed clean, if a bit tired looking. The location is convenient to the Botanic Gardens and Chinatown. But given the smells, noise and expensive internet, I wouldn't recommend it. If I go to Sydney again, I will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Alpinesummit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at best. The location is OK - I found it quite accessible and easy to walk most places. The restaurant on the 1st floor is OK, nothing great, but not bad either. Not a bad stay at all, just not worth the price I paid. I thought it was quite expensive for an average hotel. My view out of my room was aweful - I had to stare at a construction site on the roof of another building and a boarded up building to the left. Needless to say, I kept the curtains closed the whole time. There is no balcony, that would have been really nice to have and no hot tub in the pool area. The pool was supposed to be heated, I thought is was a little cool. Internet was 25$ a day - VERY expensive if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Average -- good for single travelers”
Reviews.Author: RhondaMi
Reviews.Content: This hotel "average out" everything in an interesting way: They provide soap and shampoo -- but not toothbrush and toothpaste They provide hairdryer -- but not comb and shower cap They provide iron and iron board -- but not slippers Don't expect the hotel as a W Hotel / aloft / that kind of trendy chic hotel. The lobby looks modern, but the room is really simple. The furniture is like what you can get from ikea... Not really "hotel-like". The whole room feels like your one room studio -- especially when you are at college. It is spacious though. The location is a bonus. It is not like the really central location like Darling Harbour, but it's 3 mins walk to Museum train station (15 mins from the airport without transferring train), 10 mins walk to CBD and Sydney Tower, and 15 mins walk to Darling Harbour. Chinatown is also 10 mins away. And there is a supermarket (Coles) 2 blocks away, open from 6am till midnight, so that you can get your losing toothbrush.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: bombshell33
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Vibe Sydney a few times now (the most recent occasion being June 2011) and each time I've been very satisfied. I stay here with my Mum, and we share a twin room. The rooms are quite huge! Even with two single beds, a 3 seater sofa, coffee table and desk, there's plenty of space. There is also good storage space and the tea/coffee/fridge facilities are well thought-out. The bathrooms are a good size, with plenty of towels, and full size bathtubs with shower. The hotel is quiet, and the location is very handy, and also surprisingly quiet for a city hotel. The rooftop pool is small but well kept, and there is also a small gym. We've ordered room service a few times, and it's always been good. The vegetarian selections on the menu are limited, though (my fault for being a veggo!) Breakfast is a little pricey, but was nicely presented. The staff were very efficient and pleasant. There was only one snafu the last time I stayed, when I was charged after check-out for mini-bar items I didn't use, but it simply took a phonecall to sort it out, so I'm not upset. I would highly recommend this hotel for cost and location. It would be especially great if you were staying in Sydney for a few days, and wanted a hotel you didn't feel cooped up in.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish vibe”
Reviews.Author: joy z
Reviews.Content: the website looks good but it really a rubblish one. I have never ever go to the hotel again. the staff in the reception is very rude. i am not happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe Hotel Sydney-Great Place-would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MarkF54
Reviews.Content: Vibe Hotel. Fair price, good service, restaurant and rooms. Middle of the range prices but good value for Sydney. I would stay again. Room was very clean and linen and pillows great quality. Did not have any problems or complaints during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, location may not be what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: Susan1456
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel using a cross reference between Trip Advisor and Booking.com. Was not familiar with the set up of Sydney and we wanted to spend as much time by the harbor as possible. The hotel is about 14 blocks from the Harbor/Opera House/Ferries. We wanted to walk as much as possible and found we were taking taxis instead. It is located near shopping-7-8 blocks. Not a great location as far as food/restaurants. The hotel is promoted as hip and new. We have stayed at The W chain, so I would not say this was "a happenin' place". It was clean and up to date, it had a restaurant that was good on location. The room was really large and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. I would not stay there as a family but more as "passing through". There were a few pilots checking out on a regular basis. My one bad experience was coming back around 11 in the evening and being on the elevator with a drunk and his paid companion. You are located near a "massage parlor" that has a good business so dont be surprised as to whom you are in the elevator with. I only gave it an average VS a very good because it did not fit OUR needs.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with above average, friendly, welcoming staff, but horrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: kendacranfield
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, clean and functional, but despite the friendly, helpful staff and great location, we'd not return until they put in new beds. The mattresses sagged so badly that I suffered serious back problems and required Chiropractic treatment for several days, while in Sydney. The area is very accessible to the CBD and all shopping, transit and local sights, with an on site restaurant. The area is very busy and very noisy, with emergency vehicles and sirens passing all night long, so opening the windows wasn't an option. It has a lot of potential and with some cosmetic improvements and new bedding, it would be a great place to stay in Sydney. Until then, it is with regret, that we can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: obliqueipod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot for the early morning walk to the office. A good walk to the centre of Sydney but still ok. Rooms were clean and bigger than I expected. Good price although there is a charge foe using a credit card to pay the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: philco214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May for 2 nights and saw much of the city. The room was nice and large and sparkling clean with a flat screen TV and a large updated bathroom. When we arrived, we were early and the room was not ready. The staff was more than happy to store our bags for us so we could begin our sightseeing. We made our way down to Chinatown with the excellent directions from the hotel staff and found some great shopping and souvenirs. We also used the free tourist bus, that runs a loop around the city to visit Sydney Harbour and the opera house and other sights. The restaurant at the hotel was OK, but there are lots of places in the area to eat at better prices. I would stay here again, but would like to stay on the harbour if $$ allows..

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Qldstar
Reviews.Content: Whilst it is not the best location in Sydney, it is very easy to access if you are driving. The hotel has very large rooms with great staff. I have now stayed here a few times and always feel very comfortable. They also have a great gym and pool area. I think that this hotel is very well priced as Sydney can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: Bradj088
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel...very close to george street and all of the shops etc..would be a great place for tourists as it's within walking distance of the oprah house and the bridge..nice sized rooms..breakfast was fine

Reviews.Title: “All round solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asianteentraveller
Reviews.Content: There is really not much to complain about Vibe, for me anyway. It is conveniently located; close to Museum station and Central station and a 5-10 minute walk will get you into the main shopping areas, service was efficient, the rooms were a very good size with ok decor and it is very competitively priced for its location. We were also pleasantly surprised that they had one room, out of two, ready for us when we arrived around 9am. The only problems I had were with the electronics in the room which were slightly worn out. The free tourist bus also stops close to the hotel but I didn't use it as everything is really within walking distance. Overall Vibe fits the bill perfectly for the amount you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Just to say thankyou”
Reviews.Author: tenoctober
Reviews.Content: For answering reviews. I have been in customer service for many years and always try to excel in this area so it can be disappointing when you go somewhere and the experience is a let down. I always make a point of acknowledging great service when I am receiving it and also give positive feedback to staff at all times when I can. I KNOW being nice 24/ 7 can be exhausting and something are just out of the staffs control but the bottom line is empathy, acknowledgment and focusing on how constructive criticism can lead to some great changes and satisfaction. I am staying at your Goulburn street SydneyHotel in November and I at least know that you know know and care about your guests comments so thanks again ! Sorry had to fill in some things to submit email

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kyiha
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Vibe as they offered the best prices in the location we were seeking, and we were not disappointed. The room was large and airy, and very clean and fresh. My only complaint was we had a connecting room, and we could hear the people talking in the room next door. Not sure if it is the same in every room, but was definitely the case in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: mjl52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the edge of the CBD, Chinatown and Broadway shopping. It is a short walk to Darling Harbour and a multitude of Restaurants and shopping, but without the huge price of downtown hotels. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: annewetherspoons
Reviews.Content: After 27 hours travelling and an early morning arrival we were told our room was ready! We have never been happier! The hotel was nice, huge room, comfy bed and good shower. Not particularly fancy and not as pretentious as the website makes it seem. Good location, everything is walkable but if you're feeling lazy it's just a couple of stops to circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “Only let down is the service”
Reviews.Author: travelinginasia
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, nice rooms, great location, good amenities but the many of the staff seem to hate their jobs (or their lives?) The rooms are clean, spacious and bright. I have stayed here numerous times for business and have used different rooms. I've never been disapointed in any of them. The location is great in the centre of the city. The free city bus leaves from the corner opposite, so during the day it's very easy to get around town for free. I like the rooftop pool and small gym. Even in the winter it's nice to be able to get outside without having to go onto the street. Sadly the staff have gotten worse over the time i've stayed here. The guys on the front desk at night are very helpful, however the ones on during the day are the saddest, unhappiest hotel staff i've ever seen. They never smile and try to fob off questions from everyone. They always seem to be arguing with guests when I pass reception. The internet is very expensive. I did use it once, and had problems with it. As the internet is NOT provided by the hotel, if you have a problem they just give you a number to call. They don't even want to help. "It's not our problem". Gee thanks! Breakfast is nice - i like the instant pancake machine, however like the front desk, the breakfast lady always seems very angry. If you say good morning to her, don't expect a response. Great hotel that is severly let down in the service standard of it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in itself ok - the "vibe" was way off”
Reviews.Author: KiwiHelen7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Vibe Sydney for my 30th birthday. We definitely won't be back. To give you a wee bit of background we were only going for a weekend so put 500NZ dollars on a credit card and took enough cash for food and incidentals etc as well as prepaying everything before we arrived... On arrival the front desk asked for photo ID and a credit card, fairly standard practice. However, when the lady came back she informed us that she had "frozen" $200AU dollars on our credit card. This infuriated us as a) we were not asked if this was okay it was just done and we were told after the fact (still looking into the legalities of doing this) and b) we have never ever had this happen to us before and we travel a lot! The lady at the front desk offered no apologies or even made an attempt to resolve this matter even though it was clearly obvious we were not happy about it. On checking out I asked again when my credit card would be "unfrozen" and she said in 3-5 days. A week after we returned to NZ it was "unfrozen". Needless to say it ruined our weekend in Sydney as we more or less had to survive on the cash that we bought. The hotel in itself is okay. The rooms were comfortable and clean and we did not find them noisy. The cafe in the lobby is also excellent, the coffee was perfect and a reasonable price. I do not normally complain - as you will see from my other reviews, however, we were UTTERLY disappointed in the service this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the harbour, but a nice place overall.”
Reviews.Author: TexasAlum11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were visiting Sydney on our first trip to Australia. We stayed here for five nights in a room with twin beds and a bathroom. I found the room to be very spacious, with a large closet area, desk, and separate sitting area. There was also a flat screen TV. The beds, obviously were small, but we were primarily in our room to sleep or come back for a brief afternoon break. The shower was really good - I've found that many hotels My only real complaint about the room was the lack of a fan in the bathroom. I feel like it's not customary in Australia to provide free internet in hotels, but internet here was $12.95 AN HOUR...ridiculous. It's very difficult to find free internet in the city, so go to an internet cafe if you just need to check a few emails - much cheaper. I found the staff at the front desk to be very friendly. We were obviously not familiar to the area and the staff printed out all kinds of maps for us. Vibe is in a pretty nice area, with lots of cafes around and it's also close to a bus stop. There was also a good Indian restaurant next door. That being said, the walk to the harbour (Opera House, Botanic Gardens, etc.) is at least half an hour. I'm sure there is quicker public transportation, but we preferred to walk. The walk is definitely doable if you're in reasonable shape, but it will take you some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very nice team”
Reviews.Author: HamletSweden
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent service. Team was outstanding on the front desk. Restaurant food was of a good quality and coffee was great too.

Reviews.Title: “OK location but service below average”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently on a business trip. Location is not too bad, only a short walk to Museum station. Service wasn't great, but rooms were clean. Needs new paint, scuff marks around the walls in my room. Ordered room service late one night, very limited 24 hour menu, and the item I wanted not available as fryer had been turned off. Couldn't even provide milk to make a coffee, and didn't try and fix the situation. On a positive note the Curve cafe was great for breakfast. Overall I have stayed at better in Sydney for around the same price. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe hotel has the right vibe!!”
Reviews.Author: LouPovey
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney early morning and were worried the room would not be ready, however they managed to fit us in no problem. Room was large with a seperate area to hang clothes, bathroom and to make tea and coffee. Actually felt like a studio apartment. Overlooked a multi storey car park, so the view wasnt fabulous but this didnt put a downer on the stay at all. Ordered room service after arriving back late one evening. Food arrived promptly, still warm and very large portions. We decided to share a sandwich and a bowl of chips, just glad we didnt order two of everything!! Although hotel isnt exactly in the centre of Sydney, everything is well within reach. A quick walk one way and you ended up in China town and Darling Harbour, which is the hive of activity and a must place to visit. Staff were very friendly and even arranged our transportation back to the airport. Tried to book it for our return visit two weeks later, only to find it was already fully booked. We were very disappointed as we had enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location..”
Reviews.Author: jerelsu
Reviews.Content: I check in early on 26 May and was glad that there was room available..i was fortunate to get the room that was very quiet & peaceful as the room was facing away from the bustling noise of the roads along Goulburn Street & Elizabeth Street..but there was no nice view from the room which was not important actually. So i guess the direction of the room where it face will determine the quality of stay for the guest. I will definitely remember my room number & will ask for the same room if i were to return back to Sydney. On the whole, the room was rather clean and spacious. Counter staffs were friendly and helpful. I missed my airport transport which was booked by the hotel and the counter staff was able to schedule another one within 10 minutes thus i was able to catch up with my flight. Wi-Fi was quite expensive though. Would advised the management to have their own Wi-Fi facility instead of out-sourcing it. Cheaper price on Wi-Fi would definitely benefit & attract more guests staying at the hotel. Location was superb with Chinatown about 10min walk and Darling Harbour about 15-20 minutes walk..Main train stations (Central & Museum) were within walking distance. On the whole..nothing much to complain about during my stay with the hotel other than the Wi-Fi service. Would not mind coming back to stay at the hotel if i can get back the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable base, but don't expect a peaceful nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: bluemoonrose
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears modern and well equipped. It is situated in the CBD with the free CBD bus stopping very nearby. Alternatively Museum underground station is one block away and only 2 stops from Circular Quay. Our deal upgraded us to a V King executive room. It was a beautiful and spacious room, with a lovely kingsize bed, spa bath, fridge and pay minibar. However it was on the top floor (floor 9) and the lift only goes as far as Floor 8. On the 9th floor is situated the "rooftop" outdoor unheated pool, and indoor gym and sauna. As soon as you reach the floor you are aware of a mechanical droning noise and our room felt as if it was next to whatever it was making the noise - so much so that if you were in the bathroom with the bathroom door closed - it vibrated! We can only imagine it was either the main air conditioner chamber or lift shaft - whatever it was, the noise was constant 24/7. Also the windows are only single glazed and road noise was very bad day and night. It was so loud I was sure windows must have been open - but NO they weren't. Took to sleeping with earplugs but could still hear muffled noise.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of two stays”
Reviews.Author: Mickojames
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the begining of our stay in Australia and again four weeks later. The two stays were in different rooms in different parts and floors of the hotel. The first room was on the Goulbourne Street side of the hotel and was an upgraded room. This room was nice. It was clean and tidy in general if a little tired. The view from the room was of the Sydney skyline including the Sydney tower. We both slept well in this room which was quiet and the bed was comfortable. The TV in the room had a noisy and poor picture. The next time we stayed here the room was on the Elizabeth Street side of the hotel this was again an upgraded room. There was in fact two rooms a bedroom area and a lounge area with a TV in each. The room was clean and tidy but again a little tired the seal around the bath was stained and needed replacing. This room was very noisy particularly from the road below and the railway across the road, the noise goes on all night The windows in the rooms were double glazed but not very well as they had gaps in the sliding panes of glass which just let in the noise. If we had been staying longer than two days I would have asked for another room. Another member of my party who had a room on the top floor which also suffered from the noise on this side of the building asked for another room. The young girl on the reception was not at all sympathetic and only grudgingly found them another room after he insisted. This is not what I would expect when somebody is paying extra for a nice room. The Curve bar and resturant was good with friendly staff and a fair choice well cooked.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable room in an amazing City”
Reviews.Author: soulmates-manchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vibe hotel for 4 nights during a 3 week tour of Australia. Chose this hotel based on previous trip advisor reviews. Stayed in a large double room, was clean and tidy and served it's purpose well. Was walking distance to Sydney's many attractions and underground also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stop over”
Reviews.Author: Saphira07
Reviews.Content: Rooms larger than normal central and quiet good for business front of house staff could be more helpful and friendly but Still get the job done suggest good for business rather than holiday

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by its outward appearance”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel two months in advance, through an agency, and asked for a quiet upper story room. we arrived late in the evening because of a security alert at the airport which kept us on the tarmac for 2 hours. However when we arrived we were given a 2nd floor room overlooking the main road Elizabeth Street. However the room was large and of an interesting shape. Unfortunately we couldn't sleep because of the traffic noise. The hotel moved us with no fuss the next morning to a much smaller 7th floor room. Superficially it was a fine room - but we discovered over the next week that the walls were paper thin and you could hear the next door TV all evening. We also had endless trouble with the toilet flush which needed superhuman strength to push in which sadly neither of us have. When we asked for it to be repaired we were told nothing was wrong with it. The internet was absurdly expensive, totalling $115 for a week. The GYM (4 machines) wasn't in good shape - the bicycle was partly broken and not all the weights were there. Unfortunately I never got to try the pool because of the weather. We weren't much impressed with the position either, too much in the CBD. A shame really I wanted to like the place - but we moved out to Potts Point for our second week in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & content”
Reviews.Author: Basil135
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. I managed to walk in the door, check in & be in my room within about 10 mins. Considering the amount of hotels that I have stayed at in Sydney, this is almost a new record. The room was comfortable and the food was good. Meals were a little pricey, but not far from what I normally pay in any other hotel. Only small criticism I would have, is that one of power points in the bedroom didnâ€™t work, which I found out the next morning when my laptop was flat.

Reviews.Title: “Squeeze every cent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you stay in a hotel you want to feel relaxed. Here you have to pay for everything - water, safe, Internet and wifi. Room started to look tired and had to bend down to use shower and I am only 5"9. Location is good with most places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but just not the value we expected”
Reviews.Author: fionamceachran
Reviews.Content: I'm in 2 minds about this hotel. I stayed 5 nights and booked this hotel based on the location. Firstly I'll mention the things I liked: - The hotel foyer was clean, and the room was very clean, but the corridors were always dirty and littered with room service trays. - The room was a good size, and the sofa was a nice touch. There was plenty of room for storing and hanging clothes, and an iron and board too. - The bed was comfortable, and the sound-proofing (for central Sydney) was good. - The gym and pool on the roof was a nice idea, but I'm not a gym person, and it was too cold and rainy to swim. - The location was excellent. - It was good that the hotel let us store our bags after checkout, and use the shower before heading to the airport. Now my disappointments: - The extractor fan in the bathroom didn't work. I guess I shouldv'e reported it during the stay, but I informed them on checkout. - The toilet covered the seat with tonnes of water after every flush, and I let them know about this on checkout too. - The toiletries were especially low quality and cheap. - The WIFI was $25 per day - absolutely insane. This is the first 4 star hotel I've stayed at, in the world that didn't have free WIFI. - The staff were OK, but not great. And the Curve coffee shop staff were particularly not nice. I only bought one coffee there, but it wasn't very good, so I went a couple of blocks down and got coffee from Pie Face. Overall, for the price, I would expect a better experience, and I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean hotel and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ANANDKMOORTHY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 401 for ï¬�ve nights last week. This is a nice hotel, right in the center of the city, and conveniently located in terms of access to the cbd, or the Sydney Opera house. The opera house, the aquarium, the circular quay, the wharf, darling harbour, are all just a short ride in a taxi, which is always available in front of the hotel. Checkin was easy and so was the checkout. The room was clean, really spacious with a large bed, a sofa and enough space for storage. Breakfast is quite decent, although has absolutely no variety - every day the same fare. Indians and vegetarians will particularly enjoy staying here as there is an indian restaurant (called Jaipur) right behind the hotel. The room service was good, and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed. Overall, you won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Friendly Staff nice room - shame about check in”
Reviews.Author: Trickster_11
Reviews.Content: When we arrived here staff were very friendly but we had travelled for over 23 hours and we arrived at 9am but still couldnt check in until 1pm (we had requested an early check in). Apart from that the room was nice big and clean and hotel was nice. Swimming pool area was clean not a big swimming pool but ok to chill out and the gym was ok but the bike seat was broken and it was very hot in there. I would recommend to a friend or family member as right in the heart of the city so good place to get to places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smaller boutique hotel in the middle of Sydney”
