Reviews.Author: backpack-getn-heavy
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel is located between Central and Museum railway stations, so really easy to get to if you flying into Sydney and relying on public transport. The photos on this web-site are accurate, and yes it is funky. Bed is very comfortable but over room size is not large. There were two of us and it was comfortable, but, hey, we were out most of the time. And that's the best thing about this hotel - it's location!! It's a block away from Hyde Park in one direction and George Street / Oxford Streets ( depending whether you turn left, right or walk straight out the front door). I paid $Aus145 for a night for a double, which on the day was a bit cheaper for similar nearby - and all the usually hotel booking sites had the same rate. Nice big TV at end of bed, didn't bother with the mini-bar goodies - plenty of convenience stores/cafes around the location. Bathroom smallish with shower over bath....There is a small pool and gym on roof. I was impressed and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, rooms modern, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wearytravla
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised. Room was modern on the 4th floor and quiet and staff very helpful. Had to leave my bags whilst the cab was waiting and reception went out of their way to ensure they took my bags swiftly. Would definitely go back again. Location is a 10 minute walk to central shopping so not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: amarante1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a $199 room for one night after going to see a show just around the corner at the Metro Theatre. The room was fairly small and there were little things that I would have improved - e.g. we were left with a box of tissues that only had about 3 tissues left in it, one of the lamps didn't work etc. but overall, you have to expect these things when you are paying cheap(er) prices to stay in the heart of the city. I would stay there again due to it's location, but would hope for the finer details to be taken care of, even for $199 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: AitchHW
Reviews.Content: Our stay started badly when the telephone in the room did not work and it took hours to get it fixed. The lampshades were both broken and the whole room appeared very shabby. The reception area was always incredibly busy (the hotel management needs to put more staff on reception) and our bill was wrong on checkout. Having got internet charges (for a service that we had not used) deducted, they then appeared on my credit card and it took two international calls to get it sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary at best”
Reviews.Author: pizzaskase
Reviews.Content: Car parking $22.00, why, when it is hotel use only-money grab. Booked room with balcony- not available. Rooms are motel grade at best full of empty cupboards (why have them?) Credit card 'sucharge' on check out, why- money grab. A $200.00 'special' rate becomes $230.00 to stay, park and pay. Rang reception for some information, no answer. Rang dining room who answered as housekeeping. As much Vibe as a stale biscuit.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was wonderful, clean, modern, huge !”
Reviews.Author: Corleone37
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really awesome. The room was so large it had a big screen TV large living room, It was modern and trendy it just had a good feeling about it. Even the bathroom was awesome it had a big bath tub too :) Its one of the best hotels ive stayed at and have travelled alot ! Pool on the roof and smoking area was cool ! I highly recommend this place to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: bunnylovett
Reviews.Content: It's been a month and I'm still reeling from the experience...First interaction at check-in was "Hi I'm going to put a hold on your card for $100 bond and the FULL COST of your 4-day stay with us." Excuse me? If I had booked this hotel on a discount site I would have expected to pay for the full stay when I booked, but that's b/c it would have come at a discount. So why and WHERE does it state that GUESTS pay up front for the FULL stay on Day 1?? That is a highly un-friendly, UNUSUAL, practice pretty much everywhere. I decided not to allow that and paid for the first night just so we could get into our room and figure things out. Over the course of the next 3 days members of my party were harassed about the bill for our stay- which we hadn't completed yet!!. The concept of CUSTOMER SERVICE is foreign at Vibe Hotel Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gouges it's customers”
Reviews.Author: jmr050909
Reviews.Content: I am currently a guest at The Vibe and am writing this now even though my stay doesn't end until 2/11. Let me start with the good things. The hotel is clean, trendy, and in a great spot. The rooftop pool is extremely small but very cute. Fitness center same... Small but adequate. The location is within the 3.5 sq miles of Sydney so tou can walk to everything and/ or hop outside and across the street catch public transportation. Ok, good things stop. Bad - the hotel gouges it's customers on everything. The Internet is $24.95 for 24 hours so I'm actually writing this from the FREE wi-fi on George St... 4 blocks away. A bottle of water is $6.50 and to dry clean a dress shirt is $26. I've never in my life seen prices like this. Also, our view is of an abandoned building with broken windows... Not my dream view for my honeymoon. We got a 2-twin bed room, obviously their error, and it took an hour for someone to come up and "fix" this... Yes, they simply pushed them together to make our "king". We called for a bucket of ice and they were out of buckets! Therefore, we had to walk down to the bar and get a martini shaker full of ice. If we would have had it sent up, it was $3. Also, be prepared to pay a bond when you arrive. It is supposed to be refundable. Ours was $100. So, this is my info I have for now. I've only been here one night and I hope it gets better as we have 5 more ahead of us!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Quality”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: Pros - Service at front desk was very friendly - Baggage delivery to room was prompt (note I traveled with a large tour group) - Room size were quite large - Shower water pressure was strong - Room decor was modern Cons - Internet priced at $25/24 hour was quite expensive, even if it was fast - Breakfast buffet priced at $28, but selection was quite limited, with no cooking station - Beds were quite firm, not easy for a comfortable sleep - I can hear some subtle noise from the cars moving outside - European style shower half-glass partition, which means water splashed to bathroom floor during shower - Views were poor, generally street view

Reviews.Title: “I liked the location”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the Vibe and overall was quite happy with my stay. I enjoyed the location as it is very close to George Street and the main CBD, as well as close to Hyde Park and a short walk ( 10-15 mins) to the botanical gardens and the national Art Gallery. The hotel itself was fine. 8 floors of rooms. I changed my initial room due to outside noise and very loud airconditioning, ( 8th flloor corner room). I moved to the 7th floor with a view of a derelict builidng, but that was fine for me, as i tend to close the curtains anyway and i had been prewarned that it was at the back of the builidng, The room was smaller than my original room, but .....QUIET! So , i was very happy. It appeared clean and i was happy overall. Most of the guests that i happened to chat to seemed very happy also. The staff were always very obliging and when i complained about my original room, i was treated with courtesy and not "a pain in the neck". So full marks there.

Reviews.Title: “We had fun”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were looking for somewhere a bit upbeat to stay while she was doing a course on comedy. We chose this one on the title. The rooms were a little run down, but clean and spacious, and did have a happy vibe. I stayed in the room during most of the day, working, and found myself very comfortable and happy. The separation between the wardrobe and the sleeping area was helpful in giving us more space and privacy. The staff were nice. The location was handy to stations, shops, restaurants and cinemas.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: lorry77
Reviews.Content: When me and my husband first walked into the Vibe we immediately knew we had made the right choice. Clean, sparkling and spacious lobby. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful when asked for good places to see and eat at. We stayed on the 5th floor and had a spacious clean room with very modern facilities. Dining at the curve cafe was a great experience. The manager has obviously done a great job with his staff because they were so efficient and paid every attention to detail. It's nice to have a waiter to laugh with and make you feel at home away from home. Food was worth the money spent. After a long day of shopping at the world square which is located 2 mins walking distance from the Vibe we walked upstairs to the swimming pool and felt so relaxed. The pool could not be in a better location, far away from the street noise and located out doors, we felt far away from the world which is what we need on a holiday. I have never been so satisfied with a hotel before this. When we come back to Sydney we are definitely staying here again and next time we will bring our friends too. Vibe Hotel Sydney should to be a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel located near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Ganee
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in early December for work. The hotel is located at Goulburn Street. The surrounding is just buildings. Being a foreigner and a 1st time visitor to Sydney, I found the place was safe and vibrant. Around the hotel ------------------------- Walk down the road, there is Chinatown and plenty of Japanese, Korean and fast food place. I even found a Malaysian eatery. There is cinema complex nearby and pubs every corner. Transportation is easy. Plenty of cabs and Museum train station is nearby. There is a few convenience store nearby. Please avoid those and head to 7-11 as the those convenience store doesn't have a price tag on items and the prices varies by store. Hotel ----------------------- The hotel is clean and nice. Has a chic design and modern theme. After 11 PM, you have to use your key card in order to get into the hotel which is good security measure. I had the a Queen size bed which was quite comfortable. The room was big with a large wardrobe. The room had a study table, a couch and a large LCD TV. The bathroom was big, clean and had a bathtub. Hot water is not an issue. Overall the room was quite comfortable. Room Service ----------------------- My study lamp was not working and I wrote a note to fix it and left it on the study table. I forgot to bring it to the receptionist the next morning. However when I can back to the room in evening, I found my note was missing and the light was fixed! Amazing service. I had a few issues with my Internet connection and they were quite helpful in getting it fixed. The Internet can be slow at times or no connection, but it's ok most of the time. However for some reason Apple devices are unable to connect to their WiFi. Breakfast ----------------------- Some thing needs to improve its their breakfast spread. It's the same thing every single day. Try going early for breakfast, as this hotel tends to stock up on tour crowds. I do take pity on the waitresses trying to manage them and plates/food can run out some times. Gym and Swimming Pool ----------------------- There is a pool on the top floor, please do not expect a Olympic size pool. It's decent enough for few stroke. The gym is OK but has limited equipments. Overall, the rooms are fine, service is good and perhaps the breakfast buffet needs to improve. Good place to stay, short or long term.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Good price!”
Reviews.Author: travelmany88
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a good price to book online from expedia on new year's eve. The room is spacious with 2 single bed and 1 sofa bed. The design is modern. Museum station is just next block. The syndey free 555 shuttle bus is just 2 minutes walk distance from the hotel. The staff are helpful. Close to supermarket "Coles" and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to Explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mikey085
Reviews.Content: Although there was a problem with our booking we were upgraded free of charge to the inconvenience. Staff very friendly. Hotel is an excellent base to explore Sydney. Approx 15 minutes walk from the main harbour, and only 2 quick metro stops if you are feeling lazy and donâ€™t want to walk back after an evening! Pool is ideal for a quick dip after sightseeing. Breakfast is well stocked (although not included in our room price). Hotel was excellent value, room was a nice size and quiet with nice power shower and all vital hotel amenities. Would defiantly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but beware deceptive check in”
Reviews.Author: travellingMs
Reviews.Content: Additional funds to spare?? - The hotel is in a great location - near to museum station and an easy walk to anywhere in the CBD, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Quite comfortable and clean, good king bed, LCD foxtel TV, pot luck with outlook (ours was a sad wall of a derelict building), pleasant reception staff - fine but not luxury - a reasonable value spot. Until we arrived home and checked our credit card! Be aware that in addition to the full price of the accommodation plus a breakfast in their bar, we were charged in excess of the full value for a 3 night stay. At checkin there was no permission asked for a 'bond' (we are in our 60's - how many wild parties did they expect) or any indication that an additional charge would be required. We happily paid the full bill on departure still without mention of holding additional unauthorised funds. The ethics of holding in excess of $600 when the full bill has been paid are questionable to say the least. Be aware, you may need double the cost of your stay in additional funds charged by the hotel (without advice or explanation) which the banks will happily allow despite no approval from you. Neither the hotel or the bank were helpful about this reprehensible practice. Both claim it will be refunded within some days ?? This is one hotel taking full advantage of this loophole to the disadvantage of potentially repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pam_girl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights for a weekend in Sydney. We thought it was a great location, walking distance to Chinatown and even down to the harbour if you've got your walking shoes on, otherwise its just 2 stops on the train to Circular Quay. Room was quite spacious, quiet and clean. My sister found a great Thai massage place just 1 min walk up from hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Vibe on Goulburn Street in November. The place was very convenient for my business trip, being close to my meeting venues, and close to shopping for afterwards. The breakfast was rather expensive, and not particularly high in the quality stakes, but the service was good, and the staff were particularly friendly. My room was very comfortable, and was refurbished with both taste and attention to detail. I was on the seventh floor, and there was very little street noise, except when a siren began to wail. The only problem was a strange gurgling from the toilet every 10-15 minutes. It wasn't particularly bad, but it was a distraction. Definitely a great place for a business trip, and I will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value hotel on the edge of Sydney's hoppin' CBD”
Reviews.Author: DURB0381
Reviews.Content: Vibe Sydney (Goulbourn Street) is a sparkling place with hip, minimalist furnishings that are nonetheless very comfortable. Staff are knowledgeable and friendly. Amazingly, when we arrived from our overnight flight at 9:30 a.m. our room was ready--and even though clearly that wouldn't always be the case, it got us off to a great start. Another plus was that Vibe is not smack in the middle of the excessively vibrant tourist areas and Central Business District, but just on the edge--still close enough to walk easily to all the tourist attractions in this beautiful city, but a little quieter. (Double- or triple-glazed windows and heavy window curtains also helped keep out street noise; we really noticed the difference when we briefly opened the windows.) In addition to walking, we readily took advantage of both the free bus and the paid public buses, with encouragement from staff, as well as of easy-to-grab taxis. Getting around was super-simple. Vibe is also very close to Chinatown, which made for several enjoyable outings. Bathroom was on the small size, but nicely equipped and more than adequate. The restaurant seemed on the expensive side for what it was, so we skipped that. We also were so busy galivanting that we never made it to the pool or the spa. We went on to seven other hotels during our month in Sydney, and yet the Vibe sticks clearly in our minds as a fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Sharla52
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Vibe. We we able to get in our room early. We walked down to the Harbour and the Rocks-also Hyde Park..good location. Our room was on the 7th floor in the corner where we had a wonderful view. Internet acess was pricey so went to a Cole's about a block away and got on-line there. Staff very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: katie23Wakefield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and we very pleased with the offering of the Vibe Hotel. We arrived at 11am and were given our room straight away and it was a very spacious room (their standard) and contained a sofa, dressing room area in addition to the usual bed, bathroom, dressing table and mini bar. The windows werent the best and let in a slight bit of the road noise but after a day around Sydney that was no issue. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but did partake of the lunch menu at AUD12.50 including a drink and utilised a voucher you can find near reception at the back of a leaflet book for a buy one get one free main meal for dinner one night which was very nice. Location is great and just a two minute walk to the Museum train stop which is 15 mins from the airport at AUD15. The whole city is within walking distance of the hotel - circa 20 mins to the Harbour, you can purchase for a ound AUD30 a bus pass from central station (10 min walk away) for the tourist bus that takes you to all the sights and the beach and is well worth it. There is a pool and although small is great to sit besides and relax after a day of sightseeing. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: junior-twit
Reviews.Content: Room was nice size Staff friendly but... The hotel is not particularly handy for any of the main tourist places, a good 15 minute walk to Darling harbour and 25/30 minutes to Circular Quay The internet charges are ridiculously high Food was OK but no better On our first night we just wanted a quiet drink but the bar shut at 10pm Overall there are better options in Sydney not as hip as it thinks it is

Reviews.Title: “You could get better for your money...”
Reviews.Author: WoodwayGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Check in was good, the girl who assisted us, was very helpful. The room was sparce, seemed to me like a student room, Duvet was so thin!! The location is ok, but is not by Darling Harbour as described on the website. Out of the 5 nights we stayed, our room was only cleaned twice! Having complained to he receptionist, they just smiled and said sorry, so on the occasions our room was not cleaned, we only found out about midnight when we returned from a day out!! At that time we did not want it done so just had clean towels. We were not happy! You need to use your key card to get into the hotel after 11pm, but twice this did not work. Overall, this hotel needs some work and staff training. Wouldn't recommend it, or stay in a Vibe hotel again. On the plus side, Sydney was amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: rabbit8025
Reviews.Content: ideal place to stay, centrally located to trains,buses, 25 mins walk to circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is awful - stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: janed0ugh
Reviews.Content: Where I come from, we call this Lipstick On A Pig. The website photos make it seem much nicer than it really is. The hotel is in a great location - you can walk to any of the main tourist attractions in/around the CBD. It's also attached to a small cafe if you need your caffeine. But the place is a dump. The lobby is dingy. Our room was DIRTY. There was someone else's hair in our bed (IN, not ON) - I'm afraid I always pull back the bedcover to see what the inside looks like, where I am going to be sleeping. It's because of things like this. Other hair in my sheets?? GROSS!!! The sofa had burn holes and stains on it. The carpet in the common hallways stinks and has stains. The carpet in the room was dirty. There was a TON of mold in the poorly designed bathroom. Oh, and the shower head Whined and Wailed while it was running. And you could tell when your neighbors were showering because their shower heads did the same thing. Parking is available conveniently across the street - be prepared to pay a small fortune, but you are in the heart of things after all. However, if you have your own car, there is no place to pull up and leave the vehicle so you can offload luggage, people, etc. unless you happen to be lucky enough to land one of the 3 or 4 curbside spots on the side street. Our room had a horrible view and currently there is loud street construction going on on one side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetVortex
Reviews.Content: As my wife and I were flying to Canberra and the kids had been taken care of for the weekend, we decided to stay at a city hotel instead of an airport hotel. on ratestogo.com.au we got an excellent rate with breakfast and parking for $121.00. At the end of the day as we were checking in late all we wanted was a comfy bed and a room that was clean. Check in staff were great, we went to our room, even though it was non smoking, the room smelt like an 90's pub in the suburbs, we were advised that a large tour group had only checked out a few days prior and they were de smelling some of the rooms as they were smoking in them, no problems a quick room change and apologies. Room was clean, bright and fresh, soft furnishings were modern and the hotel looked in reasonable shape, the last time I stayed it was the old Southern Cross Hotel in the mid 90's. Everything was quite, windows were an old 60's design and opended slighty to let some air in, not to much road noise, but if there was we just closed the window. Buffet breakfast which was included was fresh and plenty of selection - mind you as we had a 9.30am flight we had breakfast at 7.00am so we were one of the first in. Staff were relexed and friendly, could even have a chat/joke with them. Check out was seemless. Only comments to improve, keep up with the maintenance and just fix the little things in the rooms that need touching up and a coat of paint on some of the walls marked with trolley bags. The Hotel is in an odd ear of the city, not to much around, a 24 hour shop for those expensive chocolate cravings. Chinatown and George Street are a 5 - 10 min walk away. Overall very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Shut that Window"!”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: "It will not close"? "No" "By how much"? "About three inches - at the top. So the noise from a main street intersection comnes right on in. Oh - and it gets a bit chilly at night" "But it's a 4-star hotel. Surely they could fix it"? "Nope. It was open when I arrived - so Housekeeping know about it. I told reception, they tried to close it, and I filled in a special MAINTENANCE REQUEST form. I know that they got it because they fixed something else - but could not close the window." Room 812 - a suite at the Vibe. Nice bedroom, great bathroom, a lounge (but do we really need a piano in it?) Somehow, all of the "nice" things mean very little when you cannot sleep - because the window cannot be closed. Sleep quality - Nil, Zero, diddely-squat. Fix the window and I might be able to sleep, which will allow me to look at the rest of the hotel in a more positive frame.

Reviews.Title: “Solid mid-range Sydney option”
Reviews.Author: hazza55
Reviews.Content: Although frequent visitors to Sydney this was out first night at the Vibe and we found it to be a pretty good overnight option. The rooms, while spacious and comfortable, are pretty good value. The small bathrooms are adequate with toiletries provided and a seperate area near the bathroom for the small bar fridge, tea/coffee facilities and wardrobe. We had twin beds this time and these were good with good pillows and plenty of options on the TV, including watching my team, the Dragons, win before I flew out of Sydney. A bonus! The staff are competent and pleasant to deal with and the hotel is in a pretty good location. Its a bit away from our usual haunts but quite handy to trains. Museum Station is nearby for those catching planes, but the shuttle from the hotel is a better, cheaper option. World Square shopping, restaurants and bars are a couple of blocks away, Chinatown a bit further and Darling Harbour is a decent hike further again. Hyde Park is a block north and from there you can access the main shopping areas of the city. To visit Circular Quay for ferries to various attractions or to walk around to the Rocks is a solid hike but you can catch a bus or the train. Oxford Street is a couple of blocks away. All up there are plenty of eating, drinking and sightseeing options within easy reach so the hotel is pretty well situated. The Vibe also has its own bar and cafe/restaurant which looked good but we didn't try. We liked the Vibe and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: jestinj
Reviews.Content: The vibe hotel on goulburn street is very conveniently located with accessibility to shopping, the operahouse etc. Since its towards the end of golburn street its quite and there is not too much of a humdrum around..... The breakfast is excellent, i found the internet connection package a bit pricy. else overall a great place to stay when on work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BecSachse
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean. Room looked really funky and I loved the way it was decorated. Location was great - we were able to walk to most places, and it was only a twenty minute walk to circular quay (I walk at a moderate pace). Pool was tiny compared to other places I'd been, but noone else seemed to go in there so it turned out not to be too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable hotel, ridiculously priced WiFi”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Excellent location in the CBD, 30 min walk from the Circular Quay. There is also a free CBD shuttle during business hours. Very quiet first floor room (facing a side street). Spacious room and bathroom. Room amenities include coffee maker. Half shower door in the bathroom - not my favorite, impossible to shower without getting the floor wet. The heater was wimpy and the room would take quite a while to warm up (it was winter in Sydney). Moreover, housekeeping would always reset the thermostat to 21Â°C. Helpful hotel staff. There are a pool and a a small gym (I didn't have time to try them). One major negative point is that they charge a ridiculous $25/day for the WiFi internet connection. I think most visitors expect the WiFi to be included. Unfortunately it seems to be a widespread habit for Australian hotels to nickel-and-dime guests: WiFi charge, credit card surcharge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but very average”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Canvey
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at the Vibe through a travel website offering a reduced rate, therefore found the Vibe good value for money given the central location. If we had paid full price per room, I wouldn't think this the case though. It's fine, but seems to want to be like the Aloft hotels in the US which do the whole bright, modern, funky thing that much better. Marks on the bedding and walls, damp spots in the bathroom. Varying room size - our second stay at Vibe when returning to Sydney was in a much smaller room. Slack service at breakfast and overpriced items on the breakfast menu. Reception staff very helpful and welcoming though. Handy internet terminals available in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good”
Reviews.Author: Timmyhardaway
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good. Location perfect and all was greets. Toilet a little noisy but all in all we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, reasonably priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KatherineSJ
Reviews.Content: Our room is nice and clean. The hotel's location is good , within walking distance to Central train station, George st., Chinatown, and Hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel near Central/Haymarket”
Reviews.Author: CheekyChops_xoxo
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed at the Vibe Hotel Sydney a few years ago as we were attending a function held in Haymarket. This was a cheap hotel that was very close by and within walking distance. We were all very happy with it. I have stayed here before they renovated to the new post-modern type decor, I much prefer it now after the renovations! The rooms are spacious, and quite modern. Had no problem with noise, then again, im used to city noise so maybe I cant hear it anymore. Its a good location if you wish to base your stay around Haymarket, China Town and Central. I would stay here again, and would try the North Sydney Vibe too if I was ever staying over that side of the bridge. Not a bad hotel. The swimming pool and the sauna on the roof was great :)

Reviews.Title: “A good solid 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZdad
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Vibe on a short business trip. It is a classic older hotel that has been given a make over and mostly its good news. The staff we're friendly and relaxed, and the rooms are a good size and the furniture and linen seems new and modern. The room service was prompt and the food was good standard fare. For breakfast you could choose from the AU$32 all you can eat buffet or for a more normal sized breakfast at a reasonable price, there is a cafe who do a great Eggs Benedict. There were only two downsides: Firstly, as someone else mentioned, the sound proofing is not the best and you can hear people and their TV in the adjoining rooms, or people in the hallway. Secondly, like many hotels paying AU$30 a day for broadband is just plain wrong in this day and age. But overall, its a good solid 4 star hotel and I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: Guadalix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good distance from the Circular Quay, probably a 20 minute brisk walk. It is clean and comfortable with spacious rooms. One minor niggle was that large bottles of water are left in the bathroom and by the bed. It is only on close perusal that you realise that these are not free and in fact are charged at $6.50 each. The staff we encountered were slightly off hand and not particularly helpful .The cafe/restaurant was run in an amateurish way with food delayed and cold on arrival.The pub opposite offers good food at a reasnable price

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Warnsey77
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the vibe. lovely hotel with very modern interior. the location was great and we had a good overall stay there. would recommend to anyone. make sure to get a good price, we booked through lastminute.com.au

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Vibe for a few nights last month during our Australia vacation. It's a trendy hotel very similar to the ACE NYC in many ways: the modern deco and the apartment building conversion. It does have bigger rooms and more windows. The hotel is located on the south end of downtown area (or CBD-Central Business District, as Aussies put it). The free CBD shuttle runs in front of it on Elisabeth St., very convenient. The free shuttle runs in circles from both directions and the route and schedule can be found at the concierge desk (though we never found anyone person there). It's about 10 minutes walk to China town and attractions in Darling Harbor. It's NOT close to the Sydney fish market, which I highly recommend to visit. It took us about 30 minutes to walk there. We took the airport hotel shuttle to and from the hotel. It's AUD $14 one way and the driver offered AUD$10 for return trip. We took it. Both drives (from and to airport) took about 15-20 minutes, but the return shuttle took about 20 minutes extra for picking up at other hotels near by. Not a problem. We arrived at the hotel around 11:30pm and the door was locked. It appeared that guests can open the door with their room keys. We were let in by two other guests while the check-in clerk was busy and didn't see us outside (they probably would have if we knocked harder or stayed there longer). The room was clean but a bit noisy from street noise for a 2nd floor room. We were moved to a higher floor the next night without any problem. Just left the packed luggage in the original room and they moved us to a new room later that day. The sound insulation was terrible. We could hear almost everything on the hallway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We left a small tip on the night stand but the cleaning staff never took it. The room is very clean. The bed and bedding are comfortable. The bathroom is small but adequate. I do have problems with it doesn't have an exhaust fan and the toilet is far too close to the wall on the side. Additionally, I'm not a big guy but my shoulder was up against the wall while sitting on it. The gym and the pool are both on the rooftop. I swam in the pool and it's small but okay. Although it claims to be a four star hotel, I really think it's a very good 3-star one. There are no house phones in each floor so I have to go downstairs three times (my cell roaming rate is $2/min and I didn't remember the hotel number) when my room key stopped working, which is another problem. Although the staff replaced the key and apologized, it's really a problem with the hotel itself. The Internet is expensive and the wireless doesn't work on all floors (lower floors only, I think). The room service is surprisingly cheap comparing to food elsewhere, but I never tried it. The bottom line is that I may still consider this hotel if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Lantana_UK
Reviews.Content: If your budget won't stretch to Harbourside but you still want a decent standard of hotel, the Vibe is a great option to base yourself at for exploring Sydney. I stayed there in April 2010 for 6 nights . My standard room was a good size and would be happily spacious enough for 2 people without feeling cramped. It was well equipped with a generous amount of wardrobe space and a clean, modern bathroom/shower with toiletries, widescreen tv, safe, well stocked fridge, hairdryer, iron /ironing board - in fact everything you need. The bed was very comfortable and the decor is 'funky modern' ,but not overwhelmingly so. My travelling companion had booked an executive suite and it was more like an apartment - very generous in size with a jacuzzi bath. We had found very good rates on Expedia - better than booking direct. Just a small warning - if you book an Executive suite , they are situated on the roof terrace floor and the lift stops one floor below -so you will have to lug your luggage up a couple of short flights of stairs to get to your suite. ( Or find someone to do it for you!) The roof terrace is a haven after a hot day sightseeing -with sunbeds and a clean well maintained pool. There are tables and chairs to one side at a slightly lower level which also serve as a smoking area. Next to the roof terrace area is a small inside gym with several fitness machines. If you don't want to pay hotel room broadband rates, there are 3 terminals in reception at cheaper rates . Or you can sit on the roof terrace with your netbook/laptop and try surfing for some free wifi.... Food : the Vibe's Curve cafe provides breakfast, lunch and evening options and snacks throughout the day - it also has a well stocked bar. For cheaper breakfast eats there is also a cafe serving less expensive choices at the hotel directly adjoining the Vibe. If you want a decent evening meal and don't want to 'eat in ' or walk too far - directly across the road from reception is the Crown Hotel. Despite looking like a regular 'pub' , this has an absolute treasure of a bistro restaurant upstairs. Linen table cloths, good service and cosy ambience and fantastically good hearty bistro style food at very reasonable prices. I had some of the best Aussie fish n chips there I've ever had. My friend and I ate there 3 times! Highly recommended. Sightseeing / location. Darling Harbour and Chinatown are an easy walk and so is Oxford Street. But for heading down towards the Harbour - the new(ish) FREE shuttle bus is literally a couple of minutes away on Elizabeth Street . Route 555 will take you down to the Quay and back again. Or drop you off outside David Jones if you want to indulge in some shopping therapy. It runs every 10 minutes throughout the day and some evenings, and at weekends too. All info and bus times here : http://www.sydneybuses.info/free-cbd-shuttle.htm All in all, The Vibe is a very reasonabley priced, easy and convenient choice for Sydney - it is modern but with more character than a 'conference hotel' , clean, comfortable and friendly and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: FlatironsTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Vibe's best feature is the location: a few blocks away from Chinatown for superb and reasonably priced food while smack between the Museum and Central Station stop for the train to / from the airport. Likewise the free CBD bus that takes you to Circular Quay is only two blocks away. You can also easily walk to Circular Quay and the business / shopping areas downtown. The staff was helpful. The room -- and the hotel itself -- is clean but slightly dated and the room could use a coat of paint. The bathroom is clean and hot water plentiful. The room is kept spanking clean everyday. And our room on the 6th floor is blissfully quiet due to some powerful double paned windows. For what we paid (about US$130/ night) it is a great value no question. But the room was not as nice as pictures on the hotel's website. And our 6th floor hallway smelled like curry for the 3 days that we were there probably because the air intake is next to an Indian restaurant. However, our room did not smell like curry thank goodness. Do stay for the location and good value but don't expect it to be in tiptop shape.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravller-CHC
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney from overseas very early, Expecting not to be able to checkin, However, We were made feel VERY Welcome, and told our room was ready, no problem. The rates were very good for Sydney. The Staff Were VERY helpful and couldn't do enough to help, Very impressed with this one. The Location is Very close to Paddy's Market, China Town, 1 Block from Hyde Park and a Great Cafe there for breakfast in the park. Lovely Roof top pool. And close to free transport down to Circular Quay. The only down point was our room didn't get cleaned a couple of days, However the staff, Once Alerted at the front desk took care of it straight away! I Would Happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Tino pai! - excellant”
Reviews.Author: Tauroa2
Reviews.Content: My husband and i oand my two boys aged 16 and 9 just checked out of the Vibe<Sydney yesterday monring! 09.05.2010. We had a fantastic stay and would like to thank all the front line staff (and others) for their great hospitality and very welcoming manner and very helpful advice. We will definately be telling others about our stay their and highly recommending the Vibe. Thanks so much. Heoi ano (till we meet again) The Ngawhikas - Rotorua New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great location”
Reviews.Author: mikemaher
Reviews.Content: The Vibe did not disappoint. Well located near public transport (Museum station a block away and Central a couple of blocks away) and close to Chinatown. Walking distance to many attractions. Restaurants and cafes close by as well as convenience shops. Room size was huge (we were on 9th floor). Even so, noise of sirens and trains was constant and slightly irritating. Check-in staff were all very good, pleasant and helpful. Shuttle bus to airport is reasonably proced (cheaper than taxi). Would definitely stay here again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Turned out to be quite nice”
Reviews.Author: 2Ad2Ch
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney with three other women who were colleagues and we had booked two twin rooms. About an hour before we left for our 3 hour train trip to get to Sydney the hotel phoned us to let us know there'd been a mix up and we were now lobbed into one room with four beds. We didn't really mind but the fact they'd left it so late to tell us wasn't really acceptable. But the efficient girl at reception handled it well. Unfortunately our room wasn't ready for us (this is at 2:30pm) so we were invited to have a complimentary coffee while the room was being finished and then offered complimentary breakfast in the morning which was very nice. The room ended up being okay, bit like Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (except there was only 4 of us :-). There apparently was a bit of noise but I took earplugs and heard none of it. The free brekky in the morning was sumptuous and very enjoyable, even more so because we didn't have to pay the $28 it would have cost us if they'd not stuffed up our booking! I would definitely recommend staying here and would stay here again. It's so close to everything - ten minute walk from Central, fifteen minute walk to anywhere else. It's so central to all you want to see in Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & staff but be prepared for the loud traffic keeping you awake at night”
Reviews.Author: Charlsie78
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location & had great staff. Rooms are a good size & there is lots of space. The location is great as you are walking distance to everything. Only downfall was the extremely loud outside traffic during nights. I stayed for 4 nights & on the third decided to book an early flight home as I basically didn't sleep for the nights I stayed there which ruined my holiday. All night you could constantly hear trains, sirens, cars, buses & drunk people, I was on the third floor so be sure to book on a high level if you decide to stay there. The noise is the only thing that lets this hotel down oh & the food. The breakfast was pretty average & we ordered a pizza from room service which came frozen twice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, there are better hotels around for better value”
Reviews.Author: Tripper2Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The first room was very standard and the shower didn't work. The next room was bigger (we had to pay extra), but the toilet didn't flush properly. The second TV didn't work and the traffic noise kept us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: GOGREENIES
Reviews.Content: The Vibe was a great choice for our 4 night city stay in Sydney. We like quality but more importantly we like value for money. We paid $600 for our stay including breakfast. The breakfast area is large and comfortable with a pleasant selection of food and free newspapers. The only gripe was the poor coffee from the machine but a lovely coffee can be purchased and delivered to you from the connected cafe/bar (part of Vibe). The standard room we stayed in had heaps of storage and a lovely hot powerful shower. The room was not luxurious but was certainly modern and spacious enough. The bed initially seemed quite firm and 'springy' but it was fine once we actually slept on it. Just not what we are used to. We slept very well. There was some street noise but minor. We were on the 5th level. We take earplugs anyway. We were concerned that our room was directly opposite the lifts. On our first afternoon we found it quite noisy as people exitedly headed out. We asked if they could move us and without any drama said they would do so next day. We appreciated their attitude about this. After our first night it didnt seem like such a problem to us so we stayed put. Again they were very polite about it. The reception staff were very efficient and professional without any fake gushiness. There is daily room service, Th Vibe is 1 block from the Museum train station which can take you into Circular Quay or to the Airport. It is at the Southern end of the CBD and is an easy walk to Hyde park, Botanic Gardens, Darling Harbour, shops, Musuems etc. We really loved the handy location. We dont mind a bit of walking. The Vibe is a clean, modern (renovated) and well priced hotel in a useful part of one of the most attractive cities in the world. You dont get a broad harbour view or a concierge tripping over you so if you want to feel special you need to go get a room in one of the international chains for another $200 per night. If you like value for money and no hassles you will like the Vibe. We will stay at the Vibe next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious bedrooms, quiet rooftop pool, good location and an all around friendly vibe!”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Sydney for a year back in 2005-2006 I know the city well and a lot of the hotels, but had never stayed at The Vibe before. I wanted somewhere near to a City Rail station (which it is, Museum Station is just a few minutes up the the road) with an outdoor swimming pool and not at a huge cost in the city centre. The Vibe was a great choice. I arrived late in the evening at around 10.30pm from a long and tiring flight from London and had pre-paid via Expedia.co.uk and got a bed and breakfast rate. It was around Â£85 a night, which wasn't expensive for what I got. For two people staying in the same room it would have obviously cost less, per person sharing. Staff are all friendly and helpful. The room I had was obviously for two people or even three, as it was a spacious standard twin room, with two large beds, a sofa, large flatscreen TV and plenty of floor space. There was also a hallway and large walk in closet with mini bar next to it and a good size bathroom. The rooms at The Vibe are trendy, modern design. The whole hotel is aimed at a young, fashionable clientele and the lobby is almost like an art museum, trendy and very well designed. As it was sunny, warm weather in Sydney for the first couple of days I was there and stayed in The Vibe. I did spend some time on the sundeck and swam in the rooftop swimming pool. It was quiet and very private, with a gym down some steps below and a sauna. Breakfast was good, but it was very busy and a bit noisy in the restaurant. Orange juice had run out and hot chocolate had ran out from the machine, so I had to wait a while before the hostess had a chance to bring me a chocolate drink already made. Apart from that, there was lots of choice and a full cooked buffet, with fresh fruit and lots of breads, muffins and rolls. One let down was the wireless internet connection in the rooms, which was a ridiculous $25 a day to use, or $56 for three days, which I paid for, but got cut off suddenly. The reception had to call the outside internet provider company to complain and re-connect me without charging me again. I was annoyed when I first got told by a man at front desk that I was supposed to call the helpine myself, but it wouldn't cost me a lof of credit on my Australian mobile phone and I didn't see why I should pay extra costs for something that wasn't my error. Eventually they re-connected me and was told that I would not be charged again, but on check out I was disgusted to see that I had been charged twice for the three day connection, that was $112 just for internet connection on my laptop. The reception then had to call the company that provided the service to get a refund. What a hassle just to get internet on my laptop! Why the hell can't it just be FREE?! The internet connection expense is the only negative factor about this hotel, it's perfectly located for sightseeing Sydney and walking distance to Hyde Park, Oxford Street and all around the CBD. The train from Museum station to Circular Quay station where the harbour, Opera House and The Rocks are all located is just a couple of stops away and relaxing by the outdoor pool in the Sydney sunshine is ideal. I would stay here again, for sure, but they need to scap extra charges on using our computers in our rooms. I would rather use my laptop for free of charge in McDonalds nearby than pay again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: razim
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The service was great. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is the best part. Close to just about every bus and the museum stop on the city rail is just a block away. Very close to central station too if you are taking a trip to the mountains. I stayed here for ten days and it definitely made my vacation that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heat of everything”
Reviews.Author: girliegirl123
Reviews.Content: Any questions please email me louisemulme@yahoo.co.uk My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights and it was very good indeed. The hote from the outside looks a bit un-assusming, but once you are in there it it very good, nice big reception with friendly and helpful staff waiting to greet you, when we went to our room, we was very suprised a very big room with ample space and a big wardrobe with a safe to use and a good size bathroom. The hotel has a bar/resturant which we drunk in and it all was all good, nice drinks and friendly staff. The location is good near shops, bars and resturants, it is near a supermarket and is near the paddy markets, with lots of shops and food courts. We recommmond getting the mono rail as it goes all over the place and is a sight seeing triip with in its self. We would stay here again if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Hip Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Michealangelo
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a great rate for the hotel during Mardi Gras and loved the location - it's also very close to public transport (it's right on the loop for the free shuttle bus service around town) and is only a 15-20 minute walk to the harbour and Opera House. The lobby and bar/coffee shop were nicely updated and always seemed to have a good vibe with people always around generating a good buzz. The rooms including the bathrooms were nicely updated (although as with most hotels in NZ, the water from the shower tends to get all over the bathroom floor). The pool and the work out room seemed nice on the roof top although we never used them. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roach in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: CAASanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Our first room at the Vibe Hotel had 2 ionizers going strong - the room smelled a bit musty and moldy - so we requested another room. They were great about it - quickly we transferred to the 5th floor. At around 4 am, I walked into the bathroom and found a big (1 1/2") roach on the tile floor. I tried to kill it with a magazine, but it escaped under the door and out into the hall. Difficult to sleep after that. I did tell the front desk, and they were "sorry", but that's about it. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: NervousBoomer
Reviews.Content: I loved having the sofa/coffee table combination to relax. It was quiet, the bed was very comfortable, and the location was very convenient. The roof-top pool was small but relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable design”
Reviews.Author: tareej
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!. The rooms were modern and chic( mind you I was there for 7 days and only slept in my room for two of them)..The Hotel staff was corteous and helpful...and the Location was absolutely PERFECT...within walking distance of Darling Harbour and the shops on Oxford Street

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: 7r4v3ll3r
Reviews.Content: At around 140 dollars per night Vibe is not the cheapest but still a pretty good deal when the location and service are taken into account. My girlfriend and I stayed at Vibe for 4 nights in January '10 and were really happy with the choice. The staff were very accommodating and friendly and the room was of a good size. The only complaint would be that most of the rooms are pretty loud as they're facing the busy Elisabeth or Goulbourn streets. Ask for a room facing the back street (Foy Lane) if that's a problem for you. And do check the rooftop pool area, it's quite a nice spot to relax (the pool is a bit too small though to do serious swimming, but large enough to jump in and swim a few strokes).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, convenient to public transport and CBD”
Reviews.Author: josaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe recently when in Sydney for the Military Tattoo. A short walk from central Railway Station, the hotel is situated at the corner of Goulburn and Elizabeth St, so it is very convenient for access to almost all of Sydney. The 3rd floor room we were given was excellent - an unusual shape but a good layout, well maintained and comfortable. The windows are double, not strictly double glazed, as that infers a sealed window unit. You can actually open both windows and get some idea of what the weather is like outside the comfort of the air-conditioned room - a very good feature! Probably sound abatement is not quite as good as full double glazing, but still excellent. We certainly slept well. The only complaint with the bed is that only one (thin) pillow each was supplied initially, but the service staff cheerfully remedied this for us the next day. All other room amenities were excellent, except that Internet was not free, which is a little disappointing now. The service from everyone was also excellent - very friendly and helpful. We found the Vibe an excellent base for a few days exploring Sydney, and would strongly recommend it. The Curve restaurant /cafe/bar, part of the hotel, is a great place for breakfast or a quick lunch. Their food and drinks are top value and we were very surprised at the excellent quality at such a good price, not to mention the friendly staff . We initially booked this hotel because we had had such good experiences with Vibe North Sydney and we were in no way disppointed! Top marks to this group for having such nice hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: allybamba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vibe for 9 nights in early Dec as part of a 7 week trip around OZ. We got an amazing deal online and only paid 50UKP per night for an executive room. This place is really special - the room was massive and beautifully decorated with funky design. The floor to ceiling windows provided excellent views of Sydney and the bathroom was big and clean. The bath tub was also a jacuzzi which was good fun. Ample storage space, flat screen TV and nice pool and fitness centre made this place a real home away from home. I wish I could live there permanently!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rich_coleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in November 2009 at the Vibe Hotel and found it to be quiet, modern and comfortable. The rooms are of a reasonable size, clean, and the hotel has recently been refurbished, so the decor is of a particularly modern style. The location is convenient for Central Station, and it's a relatively easy 20 minute walk to Circular Quay. The restaurants of Haymarket and the bars of George Street are also close by if you don't mind a few minutes walk. We had little need to interact much with the staff, but when we did they were courteous and helpful, offering maps and local transport information. Despite being in the city centre, noise was not a problem in the hotel, and by booking in advance we got a nice room for a good value price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, standards as expected.”
Reviews.Author: Emello
Reviews.Content: If you book well in advance, you can get a really good price. Nice staff, clean enough rooms. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse33
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at the crack of dawn on New Years Eve after a long overnight flight from Singapore....the reception staff were most helpful and arranged for us to have the room from 10a.m. No charge for that and we were able to sleep for a few hours before the festivities of New Year...hotel is comfortable and friendly...we had a large room with all the facilities we needed..comfortable clean bed , bathroom was clean and had plenty of toiletries and towels. The hotel is well situated for Darling Harbour and even downtown Sydney... lively area , plenty of people around (it was NYE though!!)Lots of bars and places to eat within walking distance Only gripe is the expensive internet charges - we used a little shop down the road,which cost very little in comparision to hotel. .Would certainly book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Gerster2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not that much cheaper than a full 5-star hotel so we expected more or less the same level of service and overall comfort. Instead, what we found was quite disappointing. Even though everything in terms of comfort was present, the bathroom was not really clean, the room gave a warn-out impression, the sheets & blanket felt humid, there was a strange smell and breakfast was really not ok (same price as in Hilton by the way). I would not recommend it, am pretty sure you can get much better rooms for this money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NorthEast_76
Reviews.Content: We booked due to a good deal on the web (Â£550 for 10 nights). The first room we were given was a little grotty but due to problems with the safe. We were moved to a family room on the 7th floor which was brilliant. Spacious, clean and quiet. Hotel is in a great location about 5 mins walk from Central station and 5 mins from Hyde Park. The free CBD (green) bus stops opposite the hotel and will take you to Circular Quay. Didn't have breakfast as part of package but the hotel cafe did a delicious breakfast roll for about $7. Staff were very helpful - internet available in foyer for $1 for 10 mins. Pool on top floor which we didn't try - room service was reasonable, no frills food which was very welcome when you were shattered after a long flight. All in all a very pleasant stay in a fantastic city...good option at the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Value, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: entjohns51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the VIBE for a week .... I was a little hesitant because of it's centrality--would it be too noisy as I wanted to work at night. I need not have feared. I asked for a room high enough to miss the street noise at night but it was quiet. Staff - fantastic. Helpful. I was meeting with my book editor and wanted to chat in a quiet location; the 'bar' is attached to the coffee shop and not ideal so I asked for a bottle in the lobby area and we hunkered down a little out of the main traffic area. The staff kept refilling our glasses etc even though we weren't in the bar area. GREAT service hey? Facilities - Because I was on business I paid for the internet in room; be warned the internet in the lobby is VERY expensive. Pool on the roof looks fab for summer and great gym too. Breakfast was fine; room service good. But there are tons of little eateries around so don't be afraid to walk a couple of blocks. Rooms were a good size, wall mounted tvs; large bath. Price was fab about AUD150 per night but it was a special deal -- I was visiting about two weeks later and the price was significantly increased and so I moved out to the Medina in Surrey Hills which offered a better price. So keep an eye out for special deals.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyRichmond
Reviews.Content: Saw a special deal on line for the Vibe Sydney and booked two nights Saturday (02/01/2010) $119-00 and Sunday (03/01/2010) $109-00. Paid parking is directly accross road from hotel at $22-00 a night thru hotel which is pretty reasonable. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded upon arrival to one bedroom suite and we thought the room was terrific all round. If you are a light sleeper you may hear the occasional train noises as the main train line is adjacent to hotel but it's not constant so no major problem. The Hotel's Curve Bar / Coffee Lounge is nice for a drink before venturing out for dinner. We didn't eat there so can't comment on food. The hotel is convenient and walking distance to almost all Sydney CBD's major attractions and public transport. The wife and I really enjoyed our stay and at the rate really is terrific value compared to the hotels at Darling Harbour which are all considerably more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great price and a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: pamela913
Reviews.Content: You are near everything...close to Botanical Gardens, Hyde Park....bit of a hike to get ferrys but very close to the 555 (free) bus route. The front desk was excellent, Petra always seemed to be on duty when we needed help most, so I give her 5 stars too. Very nice on check in and what we could do with what we had left of our first day in Sydney. The only complaint was the remote for the TV was temperamental, had to get up and turn it on and off, we weren't in the room much so really not a bigge...could have prob called front desk but not worth it to us. We didn't have a car but there is a very very reasonable (compared to Boston at least!) car park directly across the street - Paid only $368 US for 5 nights! Love the rooms decor too, internet down in lobby, $1 dollar for 10 min. Not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Trogontraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 14 nights and had an excellent stay.I arrived with worries concerning excessive noise,having read certain reviews,but found my room very quiet despite being only 2 floors up and overlooking a major crossroads.Staff were friendly and helpful and the room large and clean.Public transport was very convenient and the 14 dollar day pass for all buses,trains and ferries incredible value.You can travel as far south as the Royal National Park on the train and I spent a couple of days just riding the ferries and exploring the areas where I reached.I found food and drink rather expensive in the city compared to what I paid later in smaller towns where a beer could be had for half what I paid on Darling Harbour but The Mamak was superb;just keep walking down Goulburn Street until you see the people queuing outside.Really cheap and acceptable meals were available in the food court above Paddy`s Market;I loved the 9 dollar Sizzlers.I actually much preferred the other parts of Australia which I visited during my 7 week visit but I suppose a stay in Sydney is essential and The Botanic Gardens and the nearby New South Wales Museum of Art (both free!) are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel great value for money”
Reviews.Author: red0ne77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vibe for 6 nights and it was fantastic! The rooms are massive and comfortable. I had a minor issue when my room hadnt been cleaned properly one day- and the staff were really helpful and gave me a free breakfast worth $20 as compensation- you cant say fairer than that! The pool is great and the rooftop space is a real bonus. The hotel decor is bright and funky and i will be definitely staying here on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachlove111
Reviews.Content: We got it cheap last minute so it was great value for what we paid. This hotel is perfect for a weekend in sydney on a budget. Its close to train/bus and city. The rooms are clean and modern. The beds/pillows were comfortable. There is an rooftop pool/drinking/smoking area which was nice. Across the road there is a pub that does awesome cheap meals... actually this place is surrounded by pubs doing awesome cheap meals. We got steak, salad and chips for 12 bucks... and it was awesome

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel. HORRIBLE service!!”
Reviews.Author: merry-vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. 6 adults, 1 child (2 yrs old) What we liked: - Location. Near to the Museum station, Hyde park, Dixon street (Chinatown), Darling Harbour. We walked everywhere with occasional railway rides. If you are in Sydney during the weekends (with kids), MAKE SURE you get the FUN day tickets. Cost~AUD$4/pax for unlimited rides i.e. railway, ferry, bus.. (VERY WORTH IT) - Room size was comfortably sufficient. What we do NOT like: - Front-desk service was HORRIBLE! Not friendly & they were extremely rude. - Room service - We stayed there for 7 nights and they only changed the bed sheets ONCE!!! When we made a complain at the front-desk, they just ignored us and gave us a look. As we walked away (stunned), the guy receptionist whispered (goodness knows about what) to another lady receptionist while looking at us. When we requested for a late checkout, they wanted to charge us 1/3 of the full day price PER HOUR!!! We even found socks & underwear at the top shelf (where they placed the extra pillow)!!! - VERY NOISY! Our room faced the multi-level car-park and the noise from the "all-night-long" ambulances and traffic was disturbing. It did not allow us the relaxation that we expected from a holiday. - DO NOT get the king room. My sister and spouse paid for a king room and I was in a queen room. They are EXACTLY the same except that their room had a green 2-seater sofa! NOT WORTH the price!

Reviews.Title: “funk in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan J
Reviews.Content: big room on the "executive" floor but had to walk up one flight of stairs from 8 to 9 - nice for us! great neighborhood that is really close to everything - didn't use a taxi or bus during our stay at all. great restaurants right around the corner - Longrain and Thai Nesia. nice stay at a nice, clean property.

Reviews.Title: “NOT so 4 star”
Reviews.Author: feefeelasvegas
Reviews.Content: Not so 4 star, we arrived and the lobby is very nice along with the dinning room, but as we started to check in the customer service was not so good, the girl behind the counter was very rude, ( must have been having a bad day ) we had requsted 2 x queen beds, she inf,ormed us that they had given us 2 x king size , we thought great, as we went into the room, the beds were singles, the view was a brick wall which is ok someone has to have it, but would be nice if you could see out the dirty windows. so there was a hole in the carpet in the middle of the walk way to the beds, and no list of numbers to call front desk. so i walked back down to talk with her regarding the beds, I was told "well your room was not ready so i put you in that one, what you want me to do about it " After returneing from lunch to find they had changed the beds. i went to bathroom well need i say more , MOULD, DIRTY BATH, LARGE CHIP IN BATH, DIRTY TILES, NO PLUG. This time i went down again and asked for the manager. " is this a 4 star hotel " reply " YES" oh well in that case could you please get soemone to come clean our bathroom, and also told him about the customer service we recived " i am sorry " turns out they need to get some stronger bleach, still dirty..... then we got asorry letter frm manager with breakfast vouchers at midnight under the door, then again in morning another copy of the same letter not signed with more breakfast vouchers.. They could not even make amends with out stuffing it up. . THIS IS ABOUT A 2 START HOTEL...... THINK TWICE

Reviews.Title: “OK room but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ListySTI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of 3 weeks traveling. We had been spoilt on our first trip to Sydney staying in the Four Seasons. We chose this hotel however as we had seen enough of Circular Quay and wanted to be nearer Darling Harbour. Upon our arrival we were shown to our room which overlooked a multi-storey car park and was dim and unpleasant. The lady at reception however was amenable when we asked to move and eventually we got an OK room on the fourth floor. The room itself was tidy enough although slightly strangely set out with a partition in front of the bathroom. This is a city hotel and it is not really near much except for the South end of Hyde Park so be prepared to do some walking. We knew where it was though and weren't expecting the earth. However, what really did let this hotel down was the service and staff. While the lady who booked us in was helpful, nobody else really seemed to care much about the guests. The bar was closed early most evenings and when I asked for a drink the bar staff seemed to resent it. The concierge was continually absent and we had to wait outside at night to be let back into the hotel at 11pm. Where the hotel really let us down was after-sales however. We booked our trip to the airport through the hotel and were collected correctly. However we have found that we have been charged twice for this, once by the bus company and once by the hotel. Unfortunately we did not find this out until we were back in the UK. I had to send 3 emails to various Vibe email addresses before I got any response from the hotel. The response I got however was basically "not our problem mate" despite the fact they were the ones who booked the hotel. When I asked for further details on how to proceed in this matter the hotel manager, Eugene Human ceased communicating and did not respond. I am now left with a very sour taste in my mouth and would advise anyone who is a tourist to not waste their time visiting this hotel. There are better value, better located hotels with far better service in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JackSouth
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Vibe hotel (Goulburn Street) -good location,rooms were spacious and clean.The only disappointment: we were charged for something we didn't use.If one can handle such small and cheap tricks -the hotel is fine and well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMints
Reviews.Content: I stayed at at The Vibe with a group of friends. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (which we expected) so we were able to drop our bags and take a shower on the top floor where the pool and gym are located - which was well needed after a long flight from London. The girl on check in was very helpful and friendly and kindly called us when I rooms were ready. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The location is spot great - just a 10min walk to Darling Harbour, 30mins from Circular Quay (Harbour Bridge/Opera House) and the lovely Rocks area. the nearest train station is Museum which is just one stop from Central Station with great links all over Sydney and the wider area. Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & clean hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night for business. Friendly staff checked me in and was on the 4th floor near the lift which worried me because of the potential noise. However, did not get disturbed at all and had a good night sleep. The room was modern, but a little worn around the edges. Overall very clean and comfortable. Breakfast - included in my package - was a basic buffet with reasonable selections. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Cabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vibe Sydney and was pleasantly surprised. Some of the reviews mentioned that it was noisy, but we didn't find that to be a problem. The location was wonderful, we were able to walk almost everywhere. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Since we were going to arrive in Sydney at 6:00 am after a 15 hour flight I made reservations for the day before, so we would have a room when we arrived. We were in our room within less than 10 minutes of our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at vibe”
Reviews.Author: sfbrowneyedgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July and were satisfied with the twin room we booked. The room was large with a big flat screen tv. It is well situated and there is a Coles Supermarket down the street. Our only issue was our room being charged for something from the cafe in the lobby ( I guess someone charged something to our room number). When I mentioned it at check-out, the front desk assured me there would be no charge but when the credit card bill came in, there it was. Make sure you are not charged for anything you did not order.

Reviews.Title: “Great Aussie Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: meganpd
Reviews.Content: Bright colors and friendly service make this hotel a great stay for a great price! The maid service could've done a little more but all in all the modern decor makes for a wonderful environment!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. At 50% off amenities were adequate.”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: Booked thru travelzoo as 50% off and hotels reviews were good. If having a promotion of 50% off then you would think they would be showcasing reasons to return. Poor service and plenty to moan about. Requested 2 queens and travelling with friend and daughter. Reception stated had given up 2 kings and on arrival to room was one queen and two singles, facing a back alley with construction noise. Unable to find a number for reception anywhere in room so a trip back down to the foyer. Reception had beds pushed together but after the receptionist who had stated 2 kings had given some attitude. Bath appeared yellow and as previously reviewed had odd odour. Mould on ceiling and tiles and the baths resurfacing was coming away (photos to follow) and no plug. Carpet fraying at joins in room and in hallway. Manager notified very helpful and had bath cleaned and plug supplied. 12.40am awoken by a drunk female english backpacker screaming she was going to 'fly back to England' but of course her 'friends' were trying to talk her down...... eventually things quietened down when someone from hotel staff removed her from the floor. At this time a letter was found put under the door from manager with an apology and two complimentary breakfast vouchers. Beautiful scrambled eggs and really nifty 'one touch button' pancake maker for my daughter but food was not overly hot and at 28 dollars its not surprising there was only one other couple in the restaurant. Internet 25 dollars for 24 hours. Looked to have a very decent gym, pool loungers are not as fancy as the ones pictured above!! Very dissappointed with service and quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Chic Atmosphere, Great Price...Oh And Great Karaoke Across The Street!”
Reviews.Author: Tbird209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vibe for four days during my Australian adventure and was very pleased with the experience! LOCATION: The location of the hotel is perfect! Though not clustered with some of the ritzier hotels in Sydney, it is a short ride to major sites by free green tourist bus, metro (Museum Station) or cab (A$15 to Sydney Opera House). It is also a short walk from the famous Paddy's Market (Nirvana for souvenir shoppers) and Chinatown. STAFF AND SERVICE: The front desk staff were first rate! In addition to being efficient, helpful and courteous, I found the team to be downright friendly. Housekeeping staff were also very helpful and efficient. ROOM: My room was fantastic except for the extreme lack of natural light. My window looked out at the gray wall and windows of another building and so I kept my curtains pulled during my entire stay. The furnishings were modern, clean and chic and the minibar was well-stocked with reasonably priced selections. Internet access, though not free, was quite good and very reasonably priced (I selected the 72-hour discount rate). I must also mention that the shower was the best in all of the hotels on my adventure! VALUE: At approximately US$90/night, I thought that this hotel was a real bargain but I have since learned that one can get pre-paid rates as low as $60/night (if you are absolutely sure you will not cancel). Exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, good location”
Reviews.Author: LadyLisaP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe Hotel for a couple of nights on our Australian trip. Its in a good location, near Chinatown and there is a free 'green bus' not far from the hotel (the hotel staff will tell you about it) which will take you close to Circular Quay. Other than that we walked pretty much everywhere. The room was very clean, decorated with funky colours and great furniture. There is a cafe/bar on the ground floor. Slightly over our budget, but we were only there a couple of nights so we stretched to it and it was worth it. Would definitely stay there again. LP

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, very good location and a great price”
Reviews.Author: Adairmoon
Reviews.Content: I selected the Vibe hotel as a package deal for my trip to Sydney and was unsure if it would be worth it. I was impressed with my selection. I enjoy walking and found this hotel in a great location to walk to downtown Sydney and the harbour. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean, as well as spacious. I stayed there for over two weeks and never had any issues with the hotel. Their pool was on the small side, but I was more interested in sightseeing and day trips.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: joanniet6
Reviews.Content: took advantage of hotels ,com half price sale Â£286 for 8 nights couldnt believe it excellent location for buses, trains etc great room service .

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sneezydownunder
Reviews.Content: The Vibe Hotel provided us mature ladies with a great stay. At all times we felt very safe, check in went very smoothly. We arrive at 8am, our bags were securely locked away, and we hit the shops running. Back at 3pm to find our luggage in our rooms, and we collapased. Room was tidy, beds comfortable, we also made use of the fold out sofa bed. Bathroom clean.
