We did have to request for extra crockery as it was only provided for two, and there were three of us using the room, these were provided within 20mins of us ringing. Front desk was exceptionally helpful, especially when we need to find extra shopping for our last day, and had 3 hours to fill in, having done all the immediate shops, Sophie (I think) front desk was a star. I agree with other comments regarding the street noise, but when we hit the sheets, we weren't kept awake. Hotel is very close to central railway, chinatown & paddy's markets, and an easy 10 min walk to Darlingharbour which was what we needed. Bus stop just outside, including the free city bus, a fantastic little wine shop just up the road, and the pub across on the corner did some wonderful economical meals. We didn't use the Vibe restaurant. Our deal included one night free, which made it a good value stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: SterreS
Reviews.Content: New hotel with real nice rooms. The bed was really good, the bathroom very clean. Location is okay. The staff is extremely friendly. The only thing is that it can be noisy from traffic, so if you cannot handle that, ask for a room on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: malandy
Reviews.Content: The room had a horrible smell coming from the bath sink hole. The bed was comfortable, TV worked well and the service was a little bit slack but the location was convienient

Reviews.Title: “Central & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: blavvva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel middle of March 09 and it truly is a great hotel. We managed to get a very good deal Â£53 per night without breakfast. I have to say we were very pleased when we checked in - courteous and quick service. The room had a spacious lounge + large double bed + spotless bathroom. Great widescreen TV. We had a good and quiet night and the following morning went for an early swim on the roof-top. The swimming pool is quite small, but if you go early, you can see the sunrise and have the whole poole for yourself. On that day we had breakfast in a little cafe just around the corner on Wentworth Avenue, which was ok, but there are plenty of better coffee shops on Pitt Street which is just 2 min walk from the hotel. The Vibe is surprisingly central and walking distance to the CBD. However, if you are not a big fan of walking, just hop on free bus 555 on Elizabeth Street, and it will take you right down to Sydney Harbour - Value for money!!!. Around the hotel, there are couple of medium size supermarkets (including 1 Woolworths), bars and liqueur stores 5 min. walking towards Oxford St. All in all this is a centrally located hotel with a good access to shops and the City and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: JPW1972
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the vibe for 4 days and found it to be great value for money, the room was clean and the beds comfortable which was essential after a 20 hour flight. Located near the nightlife and just a short distance from the museum train station giving great airport access $14 a ticket and also to circular quay which was much more pleasant than walking every day. Found the reception staff to be really helpful - pool and gym looked fine but didnt use on this occasion. Would definitley stay again on a reurn visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!! Other places in Sydney are better...”
Reviews.Author: jseba4220
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™d never been to Sydney when I selected Vibe, so I chose it based on location and poor advice. Now that Iâ€™ve been there, I know there are MANY hotels that are situated as well or better. And they are probably much higher class. Upon arrival, there was a dirty towel in the bathroom, an unidentified pill on the floor, food wrappers on the closet floor, lipstick prints on the mirror (?!) and a discarded nasal spray bottle on the floor. The ongoing housekeeping services were equally disappointing. The internet is ridiculously expensive ($90 for 10 hours of access) and no wi-fi is available in-room. The walls are paper-thin, so even the smallest amount of noise can be very disruptive. The staff was friendly, but not terribly skilled. When I checked in, I told the guy at the front desk that I wanted to pay my bill with cash. He said that I had to register a credit card for security. Fair enough, so I did. About 15 minutes after I got to my room, a receipt was slipped under my door showing that all eight days of my stay had already been charged to the credit card. I went to the desk to complain, and they were quick to correct the mistake a refund my money. But when all was said and done, Iâ€™d lost $50 US from currency exchange charges on their error. With so many options for accommodations in this city, there must be something of comparable price that is much better. Knowing what I know now, I would have spent more per day to have confidence in the cleanliness of my room, rather than worry about when Iâ€™d find the next discarded medical supply. Hypodermic needle, anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and well located for Darling Harbour Conference”
Reviews.Author: Jo_n_the_boys
Reviews.Content: Have just had 3 nights at Vibe, Goulbourn St in Sydney. I had a conference at Darling Harbour and specifically wanted a location that would be about a 20 minute walk from the venue (incidental exercise is always good) and close to Chinatown (where I intended to eat most nights). It was great. Booked through the hotel, their price of $135 per night was as good as wotif etc - which I thought was exceptionally well priced for Sydney. I liked the decor and the marble buddha in the foyer was very cool. The gym is very basic, but has a walker, bike and cross trainer + basic handweights, but still able to get a sweat up. I caught the train from the domestic terminal to Museum for $14.60 and was there in 10 minutes, walked about 3 blocks to get to the hotel. About 3 blocks from Chinatown where I ate for 2 nights and had room service one night (which was very good). The staff were friendly and the rooms were uncluttered and big. TV wasn't huge, but that wasn't a bother for me. Felt safe going to and from the hotel (although I wasn't out any later than about 10pm)

Reviews.Title: “Shame one big thing let them down”
Reviews.Author: Rologirlinoz
Reviews.Content: The staff checking in were lovely and staying there was an enjoyable enough experience. It wasn't until we left that we realized something was wrong. We thought we'd left two pair of shorts behind but they were large mens shorts so it seemed inconceivable to me that we had done this. We called the hotel no less than 5 times asking for them to look. Of the two times that they actually called us back, they said that there was no clothing items left behind. Then a few weeks later we noticed that there were t-shirts and underwear missing also. We knew we had really looked around the room before we left and hadn't left that many items behind. I emailed the manager stating my concern that the items had been stolen (obviously with no idea of by whom). Then I received a call back that day to say that the items were there. This was incredibly frustrating. Had they been there the whole time while I called and called and waited for calls to be returned that often weren't? Anyway the items have been mailed back to us at OUR OWN expense which for me is the final nail in the coffin. I will not stay here again. And it is a shame because when we were physically there, we didn't notice a problem and quite enjoyed our stay. This experience has ruined it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: SheJetSets
Reviews.Content: The Vibe hotel is very colorful and young. I liked all the amenities and the general aesthetic the place had to offer. I don't think any of the rooms have views that go beyond the sky scrappers next door, but the hotel is in a great location to the city's center.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Barbarasnell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated in Sydney, within easy walking distance of the Circular Harbour, Darling Harbour, Chinatown in fact most of the major sights. The room was extremely comfortable, excellent bed and lots of room. The reception staff were happy to help in any way they could. The only minor negative comment we have is that at times the music in reception was much too loud!

Reviews.Title: “Great all round”
Reviews.Author: gavin9986
Reviews.Content: Central location, huge room, very quiet within the room. Nice cool pool at the end of a hot day, lovely cafe for breakfast on ground floor. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidKarlsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice for one night each time when passing through Sydney to other places. It has a great location just south of Hyde Park, the perfect starting place to a walk up to the CBD and everything up there, and also a great walk south to Surry Hills. It's a funky, trendy place and had a great price considering the area. A good, no-hassle place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, great value, would go back...”
Reviews.Author: feewee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in Feb 09. Rate achieved online was for a 5-night package rate so the deal was really good. Not sure if we got upgraded, the didn't say so at check-in, but when we arrived at our room door, it was a separate entrance entitled Vibe Star Suite!! score!! given that it was the longest stint of a 12 night holiday it was nice to have a MASSIVE room. Couple of gripes - we don't like 2 beds pushed together to make a king bed (even tho they did have 1 sheet made over it), the bathroom decor and lighting was very dark, and sometimes the bathroom had a really bad odour... but these were all manageable and didn't impact on our overall stay. Great location, walk to city (not really Circ Quay, but def Darling Harbour in a good 20mins or more) and Surry Hills is real close , which has some great restaurants (like 1 block for some places - Longrain & La Sala restaurants which were amazing)... Hotel pool area looked real nice, though we didn't use it, and the gym wasn't equipped well enough for my gym-loving partner, but it was good enough for me to have a decent cardio workout and use of free weights... he just walked to the Fitness First on Oxford st a couple of blocks away for the weights sessions he wanted. Definitely check out the Thai massage place just next door which was just awesome... don't have any comments about the staff or service, i didn't really notice it/them at all - which has to be a good thing! overall good stay, no issues, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Purjelentaja
Reviews.Content: Friendly attentive staff, small room, clean, everything you could expect from a middle of the range city hotel. The only disappointment was very slow service in the corner cafÃ©/bar.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could be so good”
Reviews.Author: rdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so much going for it. Well located for city centre, and buses/underground. Good size comfortable rooms. Good quality buffet breakfast. Yet the one thing that lets it down, is it has a slightly shabby appearance to the hotel and rooms, even though it is obviously a modern building. I really hope it gets 'spruced up' as it could be such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: coxyUK
Reviews.Content: I booked The Vibe in Goulburn St on Hotels.com after much consideration. I needed a central location and cheap prices - I got both. I expected it to be Ok, but not great. I was really surpised at how good it really was, and would definately stay again without hesitation. We arrived early Sunday morning and cabbed it (too tired to train) and the guys at the hotel were v efficient, trying to get us an early available room, but we were happy to do a quick wash & change and head straight to Manly for sun and sand. Got back later that evening and our bags had been taken to a big room, surprisingly big and comfy. Big bed, nice flatscreen, power shower, huge wardrobe. Suited us just fine. We planned to stay just 6 nights, but booked in the full 12 night stay! It's so convenient, close to the main streets in Sydney - Pitt, George and Castlereagh streets. Cross over and you're in the right direction for the harbour - good 20min walk though, otherwise catch a bus and it's 5-6 mins. Trains to CQ via Museum station (near Hyde Park - 5 mins away) or pop down George St for Town Hall station with trains to North Sydney. Easy peasy. Get a 'green' 7-day travel pass for travel on buses/trains/ferries (forget the Sydney Explorer, just a tourist con). Kiosk near CQ. Despite it's tourist connatations, the Rocks rocks - forget The Orient (they threw us out for no reason, they get a lot of trouble apparently and target pommies!) and head to Hero of Waterloo, The Australian, The Glenmore and The Mercantile for good drinks and watching the world go by. Good eats there at the Rocks Cafe (I think - big cakes in the window so easy to spot); Italian cafe that I've forgotten name of and BBQ place - all good. Don't forget to take ferry to Manly - try Garfish for lovely seafood there, most excellent and you can BYO! Oh, and dress up and go to the 36th floor of the Shangri La Hotel in the Rocks for the best view ever and Toblerone cocktails! Also the Ocean Room near the Overseas Passenger Teminal does lovely, good value Japanese-inspired seafood as well. So many lovely places. Breakfast just about anyway is yummy if a little pricey. For trips, take bus up to Palm Beach on northern beaches, tranquil and lovely houses. Oh and forget Bondi and head to Bronte Beach instead, much nicer and have lunch at Cafe Selina (?). If you plan to dive, check out Dive Centre Manly near to Corso and ask for Richard. Oh yes, the only issue with the Vibe, don't use the broadband connection at $12 a pop and instead, turn right out of the hotel, and go into the local convenience store for $2 for 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vibe over the NYE period and was impressed. From other reviews we had not expected the feel of a newly renovated hotel and while there were a couple of signs of this, our room and the hotel generally were perfectly fine. Good location for walking down to Darling Harbour and 20-25 minutes walk to Circular Quay or get public transport. Definitely ask for a high up room to avoid any street noise, we were on the 5th floor and no issue with street noise. Agree with others go out for breakfast. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but no storage”
Reviews.Author: MAFC
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel which was clean and quite trendy but with one big problem - no where to put your clothes. We had a decent sized room but the only storage was a small (90cm wide) cupboard with 6 hangers. There were no drawers and just a couple of tiny shelves on the bedside tables. We had been travelling for 3 weeks and had five days there so to continue living out of a suitcase was unpleasant enough to mean that we would not recommend the hotel. Even if you were only there for a few days there is too little. We even asked at reception if we were missing something but all we got was a few extra hangers. The photo attached is the storage - the bit on the right is cladding covering a pillar. The location of the hotel is OK but on the fringe of the city so most of the sights are a 20 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “decent place”
Reviews.Author: fourdoor
Reviews.Content: The Vibe Hotel holds itself out as a trendy botique hotel. (Saw various advertisements for the hotel later while traveling, further confirming this). The hotel is fine, but nothing trendy or botique about it. It is a clean, decently priced, lower-mid to mid range hotel, well located just outside the central business district, in an area where a lot of similarly priced hotels are located, in addition to a lot of backpacker hotels/hostels a couple blocks away. The service is just ok, but -bonus- they have a pool. I expect the trendy botique claim by management is based on their cheap, brightly colored furniture in the lobby and music playing pretty loud in the lobby, with a flat-screen showing Austrailia's music video channel. But music and pink sofas does not a stylish/unique/interesting hotel make. So ok hotel, but not as advertised. Fd

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jayjayy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 4 bedroom room. What great value for money. The room was well sized, excellently layed out and super clean ( No tvs in odd places, no climbing over furniture to get into bed) The decor was very modern and there were no obvious signs of wear and tear on any of it. We woke up too late for the buffet breakfast but made it down in down to eat breakfast at the cafe. Which wasn't overly cheap but all of our meals were lovely... Possibly the best bacon i have eaten : ) The service was great all staff were polite and gave of the impression they were happy to be there There was no real view besdies the building next door but the position was very convenient. I have stayed in hotels 2x the price and didnt think they were at the same level. Would definately stay there again, infact im booked in again in January!

Reviews.Title: “Nice City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vodi73
Reviews.Content: Arriving from HKG at noon we were told that the room was not ready before 4pm. This was practically the only downside of the hotel. It is nicely decorated with a modern touch, the price-performance ratio is right and the location is convenient for exploring Sydney. Our room was very spacy however a little loud in the morning as it was facing the street - ask for a backside room. The hotel itself was very clean, if you do not want to eat outside try the burger of the roomservice menu, very delicious! All in all we'd choose this hotel again if we'd come back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Range”
Reviews.Author: luxurydiva
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three nights at Vibe and it was fine but not earth shattering. I contacted them direct and bargained for a good rate and also managed to get an up grade to an executive room which was large and airy. The location is quite good Its a funky but the standard of decoration is of a type which has started to go shabby very quickly. The staff were helpful and friendly and service was good. A problem with the TV was attended to immediately. The breakfast was not good. The poached eggs are rubbery, overcooked and tasteless. The sausages were dreadful and so was the coffee. Overall I would probably stay there again but only if I could get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “A great one night stand.”
Reviews.Author: Mikon
Reviews.Content: A really pleasant surprise given the price bracket. We booked this for one night between train journeys as it was an easy walk from the station not expecting much. However, our room was large, good seating area, comfortable bed and tea, coffee etc. It has good internet facilities for those not travelling with a laptop and a bar and restaurant. On the night we were there these were empty and the service poor but others tell me its usually OK. An easy walk to most of the CBD and definately a good option if you are not looking for an iconic view!

Reviews.Title: “Suprised by the price!”
Reviews.Author: captainpaula
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for 3 nights. One of those nights was Australia day and I got a room at the last minute after being let down by somewhere I had booked. This hotel suprised me, I wasn't expecting much for the price but the room was spacious, had all the usuals (tea & coffee making, fridge, couch, tv etc). The decor is a bit unusual - a lot of very bright colours, flourescent green & pink. Very comfortable bed & good quality linen. The staff were very helpful and allowed me to leave my bags with them when I had checked in very early, they gave me a key & the bags were in my room when I was able to go up at about 1ish. One of my nights there was a lot of noise from the room next door (sounded like students or a team celebrating) but I called reception and they had somebody come up straight away & ask them to be quiet. The hotel is located within a short walk to everything in the city centre and is located in an area with a lot of other hotels & hostels so there's plenty of tourists around. Overall, I would recommend staying here. The place is clean, the location is central and the staff are polite & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vibe in sydney just a few weeks ago. It is my favorite hotel in the city. Very Hip in decor and clean with quiet acomodations. For the price it is excellent. I have stayed at 3 other hotels that were more expensive and found that the Vibe is far superior to them. The breakfast buffet is very good also. I would recommend this hotel to all who travel to sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms & walking distance to most of Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Rebellion
Reviews.Content: I thought the Vibe hotel was pretty good & would recommend if you can get a room for about $120. The Vibe Room I stayed in was a decent size & my bed was made everyday with fresh clean towels in the bathroom too. Room was very clean throughout. The Mini-bar was well stocked although I didn't need to use anything - there is a Coles supermarket about 3 mins walk west from the hotel on Goulbourn St if you need anything, Reception staff had no problem finding me some cutlery when I walked in with a take-away at midnight. Didn't get a chance to try out the restaurant but if you are on a budget then the pub over the road has a cheap menu with good food like a thai green curry for $12. You can order a Pizza from room service for $20. Internet costs seemed somewhat overpriced at the hotel, I think it was $2 for 15mins, they have 3 computers in the lobby area so at least the facility is available if you want to pop on quickly. Otherwise there is a really cheap Everywhere Internet place just about one block away (3-5 mins walk) its combined with Gloria Jeans Coffee Shop on the corner of Castlereagh & Liverpool St. You get something like 150mins for $5 or an hour for $3. The banana muffins are nice too ;-) Darling harbour is about a 15-min walk. You can catch a train from Museum station, only a block away, on the corner of Hyde Park, if you don't fancy walking all the way up to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: netballhotshot
Reviews.Content: Very Poor customer service, very long wait at check-in and check-out times. Very small pool. Hotel kept credit card by accident when checking out at 10am. Didn't contact me to let me know. The first i found out about it was when i got out of a taxi at the airport at 4pm and had no credit card. I called the hotel and was told they forgot to tell me i had left it there. I had to canel the card because i needed to catch a plane. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Goulburn Street”
Reviews.Author: Academic_one
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Vibe while on a 2 week business trip. The stay was booked off the hotel website. The reciept printout clearly states the the rooms have broadband along with several other facilities. Apon arrival I discovered that broadband was not included with the room. I queried reception about this and was informed that I would have to pay an extra $24.95 per day to have access to broadband. When I asked about the receipt I was told that it was "just an indication of what could be available, not what was included". This is a clear case of false advertising. When I got to the room I discovered that it had not been cleaned properly, with rubish left in the wardrobe, and the rubish bin in the bathroom. The room was not very well sound proofed, recieving alot of traffic noise even though it is on the sixth floor. Vote with your feet. Stay somewhere else, I will next time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: sydneystay
Reviews.Content: I was massively surprised by pretty much everything. The room was only $89 a night so I arrived with quite low expectations only to be met by great service, a huge room overlooking goulburn street (not that noisy) and despite terrible tv reception it was the best value stay i've had in a long long time. Plus the location, five minutes from Crown Street in Surry Hills was brilliant. I've stayed in many hotels in Sydney over the last three years, including the massively over-rated Kirketon and the Hilton by Town Hall but, purely for what I got for my money, this rates as one of my most satisfying stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: raelarder1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Vibe hotel during the final part of a month long trip to Australia. We booked the hotel through Toga reservations and got a great discount from the rack rate. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly, as were the staff in the cafe/bar. Our room was on the 3rd floor looking out over Goulburn Street. There was a little noise from the street but nothing that bothered us. The room was just the right size for the two of us and the bathroom had a powerful shower and big bath. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Close to Central Station, Chinatown, Hyde Park and an easy walk into town. Plus the monorail and metro are close by if you don't fancy walking.

Reviews.Title: “Vibin at Vibe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadiahkimie
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on hotels in Sydney I finally decided to go with Vibe Hotel and was absolutely delighted with my stay there. The hotel was clean with colourful decor, contemporary and very tasteful, and the entire staff, from front desk to housekeeping always greeted you with a smile. I had some friends and family booked at Meriton World Towers and Hyatt at the Rocks (supposedly the most exclusive hotel in Sydney), and honestly, the service we received was so much better than these other two accommodations. The hotel is also located on a quieter main street, so you don't get much traffic noise, but the hustle and bustle is barely five minutes walk away, and we could also easily walk to Pitt St Mall, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Surry Hills, and the Museum St subway station. We arrived very early and the hotel stored our luggage for us, and had even transferred it up to our room by the time we got back from having some food and walking around. I booked a quad room with 1 king bed and 2 single beds, and it was very spacious, and the beds were comfortable. Even the bathrooms were large and spotless, cupboards huge, and our rooms were cleaned every day. I only wished there were more hangers in the closet, as well as more hooks in the bathroom to accommodate four people (there is certainly enough wall space for this) and my only major gripe is that internet is really expensive! I also didn't have much a view, but that really didn't bother me at all. Another friend booked a Master Suite and that room was MASSIVE and had a better view. I didn't try the restaurant, so can't comment. I did peep at the pool and gym upstairs, which were small but really cute and seemed equipped well enough. Didn't use either facility. Checkout was very fast. I did call for concierge to help bring our bags down, but we were in a hurry as our shuttle had arrived half an hour earlier than expected, so I didn't have the time to wait for them and lugged the luggage down via the lifts myself. All in all, I was very satisfied with Vibe Hotel and will definitely stay here again. I also can't wait to check out another Vibe location and wish one would open up in Perth soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great room, lousy amendities and terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: traveler1101
Reviews.Content: The room is great and the rate is not good as well. But that is all I can say about positive aspects of the hotel. The 'classy' rooftop swimming pool is more like a giant bath tub, and when I was there, there was only one man sun tanning. Not surprisingly, as the water in the pool did not look well-maintained. Vibe hotel is a business hotel for business people, but that was definitely not the impression I got. First of all, the internet was not working, and it takes on average 3 phone calls and 30 min before getting any of your requests attended to. The person who helped us with the internet has no basic knowledge about the internet... When we checked out, we were billed A$40 for internet charges (we only used internet to syn up our email..). We thought that the wireless internet at the lounge was complimentary since the internet in our room was down, but we were told that that was impossible and were treated as freeloathers. When I requested to look at the internet log files (I am still holding onto the log file), I saw that we were charged A$20 for 8min of internet usage!! The manager on duty, Mr. Godwin Oparah, was not only unhelpful, but was very rude to us. He accused us of lying and argued with us for more than 10 min. We were catching our flight, so this last episode totally ruined whatever good impression we had of the hotel. To rate him and his staff's service and attitude, on a scale of 0 to 10, I would give them a low 1.5. Out of the 5 counter staff I spoke to, only one of them was polite and professional. Would only recommend this hotel if you don't mind bad experience for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: dsl549
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe for 8 nights in October 2007. The room we had included a rollaway bed for our daughter, but was still large enough to accommodate us all without a squeeze. Only problem for us (we were on the first floor) is that we didn't get a bath, only a shower, which isn't great for a 3 year old. The decoration was looking a little tired and the floors were not vacuumed every day, but the bathroom was kept very clean. The restaurant was a bit of a nightmare at breakfast time. Come down at about 8am and you struggle to get a table or near the buffet. A lot of Germans seem to stay in this hotel, but maybe they were there as part of a tour group. The bar food was excellent. Modern, contemporary dishes - loved the green Thai curry, duck and risotto's. Also try the tapas dishes! All though this was a little more expensive, it was convinient for us and the price is not that bad when you consider where you are. It is about a 1 mile walk to Sydney harbour, but there are many routes you can take, if you bear to the left/straight on when you come out of the hotel you can go through the shopping areas or if you bear slightly to the right, you can walk through the park areas, which is much more pleasant at rush hour. Only problem we had was exchanging travellers cheques - the reception never had any money! All in all, good value and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the right price”
Reviews.Author: ctrunfree
Reviews.Content: The Vibe is well located within easy walking distance of most things in the CBD, and a short stroll to Central Station. It's clean and comfortable, and public areas are quite funky, but don't go expecting 4.5 star luxury. Aircon can be a little hard to get right, and except for the front desk the service is very hit and miss, but if you can get it as we did as a "secret" hotel for $126/night it's good value. We would have been disappointed with the standard if we'd paid rack rate of $330/night (does anyone actually pay this?)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kflashu
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 3 nights at the Vibe. It is a great hotel , very clean, very spacious. The room we stayed in was on the top floor and was extremely big. We were given a room with two king sized beds. The staff were great and check in and check out was made very easy. The 24hour reception was very handy for us as we had to arrive and depart very early in the morning. The hotel was very close to the city and walking distance to darling harbour. The bathroom was very big and clean which was great. The only problem we found was that the shower/bathtub could have been dangerous as it was a high step to get in and out especially when wet. Our room didn't have a view unless you count the train tracks but this wasn't an issue and the sound of the trains and traffic could hardly be heard which was great. We will definetly stay here again when we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries !”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: We may have been lucky,but we had a good stay.(5 nights) Watch out there are 2 other Vibes in town,this one is more correctly "Hotel Sydney " Helpful staff,funky decor,ground floor corner bar/cafe/eatery.Three lifts. The quieter rooms are on the back and higher up in this triangular building,but not all of them have a view across the lane.Some near by building work starting. Our twin room was easy to convert to a double. No shower mixer/thermostat a pity. Very sound proof walls. A longish but good walk through Hide Park and the city down to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: stormriderr
Reviews.Content: Came to Sydney from Hong Kong, was on a business trip, hotel was OK, but my room was next to the lift and some kind of engine room, so there was some noise and "vibration", so if you are one of those that cannot sleep well except in an ideal environment, make sure you ask for a quiet room. Otherwsie the hotel is OK.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay but a couple of flaws”
Reviews.Author: Woodster77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the vibe and overall had a great stay. Firstly the rooms were very good: modern design, spacious and with seperate dressing area. The room was clean and cleaned well during our stay. Also the corridors outside the room were wide and airey - you don't get the hemmed-in feeling you can get at some chain hotels. A couple of other bonuses were the small rooftop pool which was right next to a small gym (which was well equipped with modern machinery) and a sauna. All of these were rarely used and so made great places to unwind. The drawbacks were relatively small. Firstly the internet was too expensive ($6 for half an hour wi-fi), and secondly we ordered room service and the food was poor: not accompanied by what was promised, dry burger, over seasoned steak. That said, with so many great restaurants in Sydney, this should only be a last resort. We found the staff polite and helpful, so overall a good stay and I'd recommend, especially for the price/location.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Revenue15
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay at the Vibe so was expecting something a bit more special, it isn't cheap. It's like a standard hotl but with funky colours. Some rooms are also better than others, our parents visting from the UK got a much better room. So overall OK and clean but not worth the money. If you can get a deal $150 night would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at The Vibe hotel after getting a great deal on an executive room via needitnow.com.au and we totally loved our stay here. Firstly when we arrived check-in was a breeze, it took about 2 mins to check us in (at 10am our room was ready) we were on the top floor and had a MASSIVE room, the bathroom was huge and had a really nice spa (big enough for two) two sinks and heaps of room. There was also a really nice couch, and the bed was very comfy. The first thing I noticed was how clean the room was, everything was immaculate. We had a really good view of Elizabeth street and Centrepoint Tower. Room service was fairly quick (about 30mins) and not overly expensive (you must try the mozzarella pizza balls!) we didn't get breakfast as we though the menu was pricey (but on par with other breakfast room service prices at nearby hotels) I've stayed in lots of places in Sydney but this hotel is my fav, the people were really nice and the room was clean. We were on the street side so there was quite a bit of noise at night but we couldn't hear anthing from the other rooms. The gym and pool (which looked only half full of water) were right across the hall from our room and we didn't hear any noise from there and there were plenty of people using them. Museum station and Hyde park are only a few hundred metres from the hotel and you can easily walk to Haymarket and Darling Harbour from the hotel (we did) I would totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaTac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first three nights on arriving in Sydney - I am staying in australia for a year, so wanted somewhere nice to stay before moving on. This hotel was clean and comfy and the staff were really helpful. there was some noise on my first night - but was fine after that. One side of eh hotel has lots of traffic noise, but its not too bad with the windows closed. the pool on the roof and gym are lovely and were always empty so I had the pool to myself! There is a cafe downstairs if you want to eat there -but its so near the city I reccomend going out to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Jumbz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our trip to Australia in 2006. We were in Sydney for 1 week and I must say we loved the Vibe. The location is great located downtown with pubs all over and restaurants can be found easily as well. The rooms were very modern and funky, and you really do get a good VIBE from this hotel. That being said we did the tourist thing for a majority of the time without spending much time in the hotel at all. The pool is nice and located on the roof which is kind of interesting. Room includes a mini-bar with ridiculously high prices, but what hotel does not overcharge their mini-bar. I would recommend this hotel, very nice stay, very nice city, that being said we just used this hotel for sleep, and to relax after doing the tourist thing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: Sydney is still very full at the moment - and so this place wasn't my first choice. But it was a nice surprise - the rooms were good and spacious and a bit funky. The bed was particularly comfortable. The bathroom and wardrobe space was huge. Good size bar fringe. Seperate sofa (although it's clearly a sofa bed and a little uncomfortable). TV was sadly a bit on the small side. This location is great - it's in the seedier end of town - but I quite like that !! There are many many resturants close by of all kinds, and a couple of pubs across the road. A short walk to china town. And there is a full supermarket a couple of blocks away towards Pitt St. It's a fair walk to the Martin Place, but if your business is at this end of town - it's a good location. I didn't sample any of the food in the hotel. The broadband internet connection was the usual $29.95 for 200Mb (!) - and then it would charge you yet another $29.95 for anything over that. That's simply robbery. I used my wireless broadand instead which costs the same for 2GB a month ! Overall - pleasently surprised at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “A great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Smiley0708
Reviews.Content: The Vibe Hotel was awesome! After reading some of the reviews before booking this hotel, I was skepical..but, it was clean, great attendance, the only problem I had was with the remote, don't mess around with it, if it's not working. I was there for two days on my own, felt very safe! I stayed in the hotel for a total of 5 days. Food, of course is expensive, but... if you are hungry and not sure where to go.. just step outside the hotel, go left from the hotel and then about 2 or 3 blocks go left and you will run into China Town, lots of different foods and good prices. You can walk just about anywhere, but ladies, watch the high heels, they'll get your feet! I took off and just walked and discovered so much... The Opera House, Botanical Gardens, the parks, a dinner cruise was awesome, you can see the city night lights, the shopping....so much to do.. the weather was great! My overall experience with the hotel... GREAT! I would definitely stay there again! Clean, curtious staff, quiet...and they were all accommodating! Best advise on getting there from the airport...catch a shuttle! I took the taxi... $50, plus I tipped $5.. which I found out later, did not need to do that! I was overcharged to begin with. I took the shuttle back to the airport and it was great! a few stops on the way, but the conceire told us what time to catch to get to the A/P on time and it was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient reception, pity about everything else”
Reviews.Author: ronaldo123
Reviews.Content: A wot mystery hotel room booking, $149. No traffic noise being on the long side (south-east facing) of this triangular hotel, so I'd recommend requesting this when booking. Room has minimal freebies, just a couple of cakes of soap and shampoos. Good hairdryer. Bathroom needed maintenance. Decor is funky and plenty of well-positioned mirrors were a nice feature. Some local TV stations had dodgy reception on the ageing 4:3 TV. My partner got bitten by bed bugs. We pre-ordered room service breakfast which was delivered on time, although housekeeping woke us up at 9am on Saturday, with apologies. The full breakfast was awful: rubbery eggs, undercooked tomato, greasy hash brown, undercooked mushrooms, a nice thick slice of still-warm toast but no butter unfortunately, sausages were OK. Reception was very efficient and polite, and they were happy to hold our bags securely after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “A bit scarry!”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here after booking a "mystery room". Other than we only paid 99$ the only other positive was a decent location and the room was suprisingly quiet. However I did feel like we were in a dungeon with the world smallest window. The room was clean a decent size but with the lack of any natural light it is certainly not for the claustrophic. i would have felt more at home with a minning helmet on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fun Decor”
Reviews.Author: Clozzie
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about this hotel is it's location. We stayed at the Vibe for two nights, then travelled elsewhere, and returned for 2 nights. We took the train to and from the airport, and got off at the Museum stop, the Vibe is just one block downhill from there. From the hotel it was a short walk to Darling Harbour, and only slightly longer to Circular Quay. The train station was close for further excursions, or to get back from Circular Quay (uphill that way!). The decor was fun, very retro with velour pillowcases, lots of lime green and purple, and mirrors on the wall. The bed was large and very comfortable. Our first room (601) was very quiet, the second room (624) had a bit more noise with the plumbing for some reason... We didn't use the pool or gym, but checked it out. The pool area was nice, tide was out as some other people have commented! Gym was small but had 3 treadmills and a TV to watch while you ran. Sauna was also small, but most of them are! Ate at the restaurant for breakfast, dinner and had room service. Food better in restaurant than the room service, but both reasonably priced. The staff at reception were not particularly friendly as has also been previously commented on, but the staff in the restaurant were pleasant. I think the main issue other posters may have had is with The Vibe claiming to be 4 star. I am guessing this is due to the pool and gym - I would probably say it is more of a 3 to 3.5 stars, but we got a good price in an expensive city so we were more than happy with our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Vibe Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 111 Goulburn Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
